original: sa de'i rang bzhin ni sa gong ma la ltos na /🔽sdug bsngal bar gnas pa'i phyir nag po'i phyogs yin la /
analyzed: sa de'i rang bzhin ni sa gong ma la ltos na / sdug bsngal bar gnas pa'i phyir nag po'i phyogs yin la /
translated: The nature of this level is that,🔽in relation to the higher levels, it is the dark side, because it is a state of suffering.

original: 'dod pa dag las dben pa las skyes pa'i bde ba'i phan yon chung zad dang ldan pa yang yin te /🔽de la gnas pa la rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su sems kyi spyod pa rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / dpyod pa dang bcas pa 'byung bar 'gyur bas zhi ba bas rab tu zhi ba lta bu ma yin te /🔽de ltar rnam pa de dag gis rtog pa dag la rags pa'i mtshan nyid du so sor rtog par byed do //🔽rtog pa med pa'i bsam gtan gnyis ba la ni rnam pa thams cad du rags pa'i mtshan nyid de ltar bu med de /🔽de'i phyir bsam gtan gnyis pa ni rags pa de nyid dang bral ba'i phyir zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dag las dben pa las skyes pa'i bde ba'i phan yon chung zad dang ldan pa yang yin te /🔽de la gnas pa la rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su sems kyi spyod pa rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / dpyod pa dang bcas pa 'byung bar 'gyur bas zhi ba bas rab tu zhi ba lta bu ma yin te /🔽de ltar rnam pa de dag gis rtog pa dag la rags pa'i mtshan nyid du so sor rtog par byed do //🔽rtog pa med pa'i bsam gtan gnyis ba la ni rnam pa thams cad du rags pa'i mtshan nyid de ltar bu med de /🔽de'i phyir bsam gtan gnyis pa ni rags pa de nyid dang bral ba'i phyir zhi ba yin no //
translated: The nature of this level is as follows.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug pa yid la byed pa lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug pa yid la byed pa lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par rig par bya ste /
translated: The remaining mental attentions that enter into meditative concentration on the second meditative absorption should be understood as appropriate in the same way as before.

original: yod min med min skye mched kyi bar gyi sa dang sa dag la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa bdun po dag kyang da bzhin du ci rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: yod min med min skye mched kyi bar gyi sa dang sa dag la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa bdun po dag kyang da bzhin du ci rigs par bya'o //
translated: The seven mental attentions that enter into meditative concentration on the stages, up to and including the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, should also be understood as appropriate in the same way.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched man chad kyi sa 'og ma thams cad la rags @169a * //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched man chad kyi sa 'og ma thams cad la rags @169a * //
translated: All the lower stages, up to and including the sphere of nothingness, are characterized by coarseness.

original: pa'i mtshan nyid ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: pa'i mtshan nyid ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be understood that they are characterized by two kinds of coarseness:

original: sa 'og ma rnams ni ches sdug bsngal bar gnas shing ches rab tu ma zhi bar gnas pa dang / ches tshe thung bar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sa 'og ma rnams ni ches sdug bsngal bar gnas shing ches rab tu ma zhi bar gnas pa dang / ches tshe thung bar gnas pa ste /
translated: the lower stages are characterized by the coarseness of suffering, the coarseness of unrest, and the coarseness of a short life span.

original: de ltar rags pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis po de dag gzhi drug po de dag gis ci rigs par yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar rags pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis po de dag gzhi drug po de dag gis ci rigs par yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: These two kinds of coarseness are investigated in relation to those six bases in the appropriate manner.

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa man chad kyi sa gang dang gang dag las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dod pa'i sa gong ma rnams la ni ci rigs par zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du so sor rtog par byed do //🔽'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa man chad kyi sa gang dang gang dag las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dod pa'i sa gong ma rnams la ni ci rigs par zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du so sor rtog par byed do // 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: He correctly investigates the characteristics of peace of the higher stages, from the mental contemplation of final training up to the mental contemplation of the fruit of final training, in order to become free from attachment to the higher stages.

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa de la /
translated: He achieves and remains in the first concentration, which is free from the desires, free from evil and nonvirtuous qualities, and endowed with ideation and scrutiny, born of solitude.

original: 'dod pa dag ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Desires are of two types:

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa dang / dngos po'i 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa dang / dngos po'i 'dod pa'o //
translated: afflictive desires and substantial desires.

original: 'dod pa dag las dben pa zhes bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag las dben pa zhes bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Freedom from desires is also of two types:

original: mtshungs par ldan pa las dben pa dang / dmigs pa las dben pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa las dben pa dang / dmigs pa las dben pa'o //
translated: freedom from concomitant desires and freedom from objectified desires.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
translated: “Isolated from evil, unwholesome dharmas” means that it arises from the cause of desire.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi dge ba'i chos 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi dge ba'i chos 'di lta ste /
translated: The unwholesome, secondary afflictions are as follows:

original: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / mtshon 'byin pa dang / dbyig pa 'byin pa dang / 'thab mo dang / ma tshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang /
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / mtshon 'byin pa dang / dbyig pa 'byin pa dang / 'thab mo dang / ma tshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang /
translated: evil bodily conduct, evil verbal conduct, evil mental conduct, taking up weapons, taking up sticks, fighting, quarreling, arguing,

original: 'gyed pa dang / g-yo byed pa dang / slu ba dang / snying rje med pa dang / brdzun du smra ba kun du 'byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ste /
analyzed: 'gyed pa dang / g-yo byed pa dang / slu ba dang / snying rje med pa dang / brdzun du smra ba kun du 'byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ste /
translated: deceit, fraud, lack of compassion, and lying.

original: de dag spangs pa'i phyir sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag spangs pa'i phyir sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they are abandoned, it is called “isolated from evil, unwholesome dharmas.”

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: It has applied thought and sustained thought.

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag la skyon du mi lta ba'i phyir 'dod ba'i gnyen po rang gis pa'i rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dge ba dag dang ldan pas na /🔽rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag la skyon du mi lta ba'i phyir 'dod ba'i gnyen po rang gis pa'i rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dge ba dag dang ldan pas na / rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “accompanied by investigation and sustained thought” because it is accompanied by the wholesome investigation and sustained thought that are its own level, which counteract the desire realm, since it does not view investigation and sustained thought as faults.

original: dben pa las zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa gang dag las dben pa sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa las so //
analyzed: dben pa las zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa gang dag las dben pa sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa las so //
translated: “Arisen from seclusion” means from the mental attention that is the culmination of the application that is secluded from the desire realm.

original: skyes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skyes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Arisen” means

original: rgyu de dang rkyen des de'i mjug thogs kho nar yang dag par skyes pa la bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu de dang rkyen des de'i mjug thogs kho nar yang dag par skyes pa la bya ste /
translated: that it is properly arisen immediately after that, by that cause and by that condition.

original: de'i phyir dben pa las skyes pa zhes @169b bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dben pa las skyes pa zhes @169b bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called “arisen from seclusion.”

original: dga' ba dang bde ba can zhes bya ba de ni 'dod pa dang re ba'i don thob cing dga' ba la skyon du mi lta ba'i phyir dang / gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral zhing /
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba can zhes bya ba de ni 'dod pa dang re ba'i don thob cing dga' ba la skyon du mi lta ba'i phyir dang / gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral zhing /
translated: It is called “accompanied by joy and pleasure” because it is joy that views the attainment of the object of desire and hope as faultless, and because it is free from all the negative tendencies.

original: sems dang lus las su rung ba rgya chen po dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: sems dang lus las su rung ba rgya chen po dang ldan pas na /
translated: It is vast, for it is endowed with a vast serviceability of mind and body.🔽

original: dga' ba dang bde ba can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba can zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “joyful and blissful” because it is endowed with a vast serviceability of mind and body.

original: bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la yang dag par nye bar gtod pa dang / dran pa rtse gcig tu nye bar gtod pa'i phyir bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la yang dag par nye bar gtod pa dang / dran pa rtse gcig tu nye bar gtod pa'i phyir bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: “Concentration” is so called because it is the correct focusing of the mind on an object and the focusing of mindfulness on a single object.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni dang por 'dod pa'i khams nas bskyod pa'i go rims bzhin du bgrangs pa'i phyir dang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni dang por 'dod pa'i khams nas bskyod pa'i go rims bzhin du bgrangs pa'i phyir dang po zhes bya'o //
translated: “First” means that it is called first because it is counted in the order in which it arises, having first shaken the realm of desire.

original: bsgrubs te zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bsgrubs te zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrubs te zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bsgrubs te zhes bya'o //
translated: “Having attained” means that it is called attained because it is the fruit of the culmination of practice.

original: gnas so zhes bya ba ni phyis bsgom pa lan mang du bsgrubs pas ci 'dod pa bzhin thob pa dang / dka' ba med par thob pa dang / tshegs med par thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas so zhes bya ba ni phyis bsgom pa lan mang du bsgrubs pas ci 'dod pa bzhin thob pa dang / dka' ba med par thob pa dang / tshegs med par thob pa'i phyir /
translated: “He dwells” means that he dwells in the first concentration because he has attained it as much as he wishes, without difficulty, and without hardship, through repeated practice of meditation in the future.

original: bsam gtan gyi snyoms par 'jug pa des mtshan mo dang / nyin mo dang / nyin mtshan dang / nyin mtshan bdun gyi bar ram /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi snyoms par 'jug pa des mtshan mo dang / nyin mo dang / nyin mtshan dang / nyin mtshan bdun gyi bar ram /
translated: By means of that meditative concentration, he passes the night, the day, the night and day, or🔽as long as he wishes.

original: ji srid 'dod pa'i bar du 'da' bar byed pas na gnas so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid 'dod pa'i bar du 'da' bar byed pas na gnas so zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is said that he “dwells.”

original: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste /
analyzed: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste /
translated: He is free from conception and discernment, and his mind is inwardly clear.

original: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas /
translated: His mind is unified.

original: rtog pa med pa /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa /
translated: He is without conception.

original: dpyod pa med pa /🔽ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa de la rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa med pa / ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa de la rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: He is without discernment.🔽He has attained the second meditative concentration, which is born of samādhi and is filled with the joy and pleasure that arise from meditative concentration.

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma dag las sems rnam par bzlog nas /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma dag las sems rnam par bzlog nas /
translated: He is free from conception and discernment, and his mind is inwardly clear means that he turns his mind away from the signs of meditative concentration that is accompanied by conception and discernment.

original: rtog pa med pa dang / dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma dag la legs par gtod cing /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa dang / dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma dag la legs par gtod cing /
translated: He focuses well on the signs of the concentration that is without applied thought and sustained thought.

original: dmigs pa la mi brtan par spyod pa las rnam par phral te /
analyzed: dmigs pa la mi brtan par spyod pa las rnam par phral te /
translated: He is free from unstable conduct with regard to the meditative object.🔽He is engaged in stable conduct with regard to the meditative object.

original: dmigs pa la brtan par spyod pa la dang gcig gis sems zhi ba dang dang bar 'jug par byed cing rnam par 'jog par byed pas na /
analyzed: dmigs pa la brtan par spyod pa la dang gcig gis sems zhi ba dang dang bar 'jug par byed cing rnam par 'jog par byed pas na /
translated: He enters into and settles in a mind that is peaceful and clear.

original: de'i phyir de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “He is free from applied thought and sustained thought, and his mind is inwardly clear.”

original: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “His mind becomes unified” means

original: des bsgom pa yongs su goms par bya ba'i phyir /🔽rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de nyid la rtog pa dang dpyod pas bar du gcod cing skabs su 'chad pa'i gnas @170a * //
analyzed: des bsgom pa yongs su goms par bya ba'i phyir /🔽rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de nyid la rtog pa dang dpyod pas bar du gcod cing skabs su 'chad pa'i gnas @170a * //
translated: that, in order to cultivate that concentration,🔽he is free from applied thought and sustained thought.

original: skabs las yang dag par 'das te bar du gcod pa med pa dang / skabs su 'chad pa med pa'i gnas skabs thob pas na /
analyzed: skabs las yang dag par 'das te bar du gcod pa med pa dang / skabs su 'chad pa med pa'i gnas skabs thob pas na /
translated: It is called “one-pointed” because it has gone beyond the occasion of not being one-pointed and has attained the occasion of being one-pointed.🔽It is called “of the mind” because it is the mental consciousness that is one-pointed, not the other consciousnesses.🔽It is called “concentration” because it is the mental factor of samādhi.

original: de'i phyir sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: It is called “on that object” because it is the object of meditation that is one-pointed, not other objects.🔽It is called “having gone beyond the occasion of not being one-pointed” because it has gone beyond the occasion of not being one-pointed and has attained the occasion of being one-pointed.🔽It is called “having gone beyond the occasion of being interrupted” because it has gone beyond the occasion of being interrupted and has attained the occasion of being uninterrupted.

original: rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni //
translated: It is called “having attained the occasion of being uninterrupted” because it has gone beyond the occasion of being interrupted and has attained the occasion of being uninterrupted.🔽It is called “having attained the occasion of not being interrupted” because it has gone beyond the occasion of being interrupted and has attained the occasion of being uninterrupted.🔽It is called “having attained the occasion of not being interrupted” because it has gone beyond the occasion of being interrupted and has attained the occasion of being uninterrupted.🔽It is called “having attained the occasion of not being interrupted” because it has gone beyond the occasion of being interrupted and has attained the occasion of being uninterrupted.🔽It is called “having attained the occasion of not being interrupted” because it has gone beyond the occasion of being interrupted and has attained the occasion of being uninterrupted.🔽It is called “having attained the occasion of not being interrupted” because it has gone beyond the occasion of being interrupted and has attained the occasion of being uninterrupted.🔽It is called “having attained the occasion of not being interrupted” because it has gone beyond the occasion of being interrupted and has attained the occasion of being uninterrupted.🔽It is called “having attained the occasion of not being interrupted” because it has gone beyond the occasion of being interrupted and has attained the occasion of being uninterrupted.🔽It is called “having attained the occasion of not being interrupted” because it has gone beyond the occasion of being interrupted and has attained the occasion of being uninterrupted.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa dang / dpyod pa med pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa dang / dpyod pa med pa zhes bya'o /
translated: It is called “having attained the occasion of not being interrupted” because it has gone beyond the occasion of being interrupted and has attained the occasion of being uninterrupted.

original: dpyod pa med pa zhes bya'o //🔽ting nge 'dzin las zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa yid la byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin las so //🔽skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu de dang rkyen des de'i mjug thogs kho nar yang dag par skyes pa la bya ste /🔽de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dpyod pa med pa zhes bya'o //🔽ting nge 'dzin las zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa yid la byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin las so //🔽skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu de dang rkyen des de'i mjug thogs kho nar yang dag par skyes pa la bya ste /🔽de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: It is called “having

original: dga' ba dang / bde ba can zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang re ba'i don thob cing dga' ba la skyon du mi lta bas /
analyzed: dga' ba dang / bde ba can zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang re ba'i don thob cing dga' ba la skyon du mi lta bas /
translated: The phrase “endowed with joy and bliss” means that one is endowed with joy that is free of the fault of regarding the attainment of the object that is desired and hoped for as a shortcoming.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' ba dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' ba dang ldan zhing /
translated: One is also endowed with mental satisfaction.

original: yid bde ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dang bsam gtan dang po'i rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas de'i gnyen po sems dang lus shin tu sbyangs shing las su rung ba'i bde ba dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid bde ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dang bsam gtan dang po'i rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas de'i gnyen po sems dang lus shin tu sbyangs shing las su rung ba'i bde ba dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: And one is endowed with the bliss of mental and physical pliancy, which is the antidote to the initial investigation, subsequent analysis, and all the negative tendencies that are on the side of the mental afflictions in the first meditative absorption.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba can zhes bya'o //
translated: For these reasons, it is called “endowed with joy and bliss.”

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba la gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du bgrang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba la gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du bgrang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “he attains and remains in the second meditative absorption” means that the second meditative absorption is counted in the proper sequence.

original: lhag ma thams cad ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma thams cad ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: All of the remaining should be understood as they were described earlier.

original: de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te /
translated: Since they are free from attachment to joy, they abide in equanimity and possess mindfulness and introspection.

original: bde ba lus kyis myong la /
analyzed: bde ba lus kyis myong la /
translated: They experience physical pleasure.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de la dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de la dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa /
translated: As the noble ones have said, “They possess mindfulness and abide in pleasure,

original: btang snyoms ba'o zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms ba'o zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: which is equanimity.”

original: dga' ba med pa bsam gtan gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: dga' ba med pa bsam gtan gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa de la /
translated: They accomplish and abide in the third concentration, which is without joy.

original: de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since they are free from attachment to joy

original: dga' ba'i mtshan ma dag la skyon du lta ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dga' ba'i mtshan ma dag la skyon du lta ba'i phyir /
translated: means that they view the signs of joy as faults.

original: de'i phyir de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it says, “Since they are free from attachment to joy.”🔽Abide in equanimity

original: btang snyoms la gnas shing zhes bya ba ni dga' ba med pa bsam gtan gsum ba la sems gtod par byed ba de'i tshe na /
analyzed: btang snyoms la gnas shing zhes bya ba ni dga' ba med pa bsam gtan gsum ba la sems gtod par byed ba de'i tshe na /
translated: means that when they focus their minds on the third concentration, which is without joy,

original: de'i sems kun du 'khrug par byed pa'i skyon rnam pa gnyis po bsam gtan gnyis pa la rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / da ltar @170b kyi dga' ba dag dang bral bas na /
analyzed: de'i sems kun du 'khrug par byed pa'i skyon rnam pa gnyis po bsam gtan gnyis pa la rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / da ltar @170b kyi dga' ba dag dang bral bas na /
translated: The second concentration is free from the two faults that disturb the mind, namely, investigation and analysis, and it is free from the joy of the present moment.

original: de'i phyir btang snyoms la gnas shing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir btang snyoms la gnas shing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that “one dwells in equanimity.”

original: sems kun du 'khrug par byed pa'i chos de gnyis ni /
analyzed: sems kun du 'khrug par byed pa'i chos de gnyis ni /
translated: These two phenomena that disturb the mind

original: sems rgyun du btang snyoms su gzhag pa la gegs byed pa yin pas na /
analyzed: sems rgyun du btang snyoms su gzhag pa la gegs byed pa yin pas na /
translated: are obstacles to the continuous practice of equanimity.

original: sems kun du 'khrug par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems kun du 'khrug par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called “disturbances of the mind.”

original: de la bsam gtan dang po la ni rtog pa dang / dpyod pa yod pas des na rgyun du btang snyoms la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po la ni rtog pa dang / dpyod pa yod pas des na rgyun du btang snyoms la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the first concentration, there is investigation and analysis, and therefore, one is not continuously engaged in equanimity.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la ni dga' ba yod pas /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la ni dga' ba yod pas /
translated: In the second concentration, there is joy,

original: des na der yang rgyun du btang snyoms la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na der yang rgyun du btang snyoms la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: and therefore, one is not continuously engaged in equanimity.

original: de lta bas na bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis ba de dag la btang snyoms shas cher med pas de'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i bsam gtan pa de ni btang snyoms la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis ba de dag la btang snyoms shas cher med pas de'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i bsam gtan pa de ni btang snyoms la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since the first and second absorptions are not predominantly equanimity, the meditator who has entered the third absorption is said to abide in equanimity.🔽He is mindful and has introspection.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te zhes bya ba ni de btang snyoms la gnas ba na ji ltar dga' ba dang ldan pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pa de dag kun du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba de lta de ltar dran pa nye bar bzhag ste
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te zhes bya ba ni de btang snyoms la gnas ba na ji ltar dga' ba dang ldan pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pa de dag kun du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba de lta de ltar dran pa nye bar bzhag ste
translated: When he abides in equanimity, he is mindful and attentive so that the attention associated with joy does not arise.

original: gnas par byed do //
analyzed: gnas par byed do //
translated: He abides in this way.

original: gal te bsam gtan gsum pa legs par goms par ma byas pas brjed ngas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan gsum pa legs par goms par ma byas pas brjed ngas pa'i phyir /
translated: If he has not cultivated the third absorption well, he may become forgetful

original: brgya la brgyal ma na /
analyzed: brgya la brgyal ma na /
translated: and sometimes faint.

original: dga' bad dang ldan pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pa de dag kun du 'byung bar gyur na /
analyzed: dga' bad dang ldan pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pa de dag kun du 'byung bar gyur na /
translated: If the attention associated with joy arises,

original: myur ba myur ba kho nar de dag la shes rab kyis so sor rtog par byed /
analyzed: myur ba myur ba kho nar de dag la shes rab kyis so sor rtog par byed /
translated: he quickly and immediately examines it with wisdom.

original: legs pa kho nar rab tu shes par byed cing byung ngo cog dang du mi len par spong bar byed /
analyzed: legs pa kho nar rab tu shes par byed cing byung ngo cog dang du mi len par spong bar byed /
translated: He knows what is good and what is not good, and he does not accept what happens, but abandons it.

original: sel bar byed /
analyzed: sel bar byed /
translated: He removes it,

original: byang bar byed cing sems btang snyoms su byed pas na /
analyzed: byang bar byed cing sems btang snyoms su byed pas na /
translated: and he pacifies it, and he makes the mind neutral.

original: de'i phyir dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te zhes bya ba gsungs so ;
analyzed: de'i phyir dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te zhes bya ba gsungs so ;
translated: Therefore, it is said, “he is mindful and has introspection.”

original: / bde ba lus kyis myong ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / bde ba lus kyis myong ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “He experiences happiness with the body” means

original: de de'i tshe na gzugs kyi lus dang / yid kyi lus kyis tshor ba'i bde ba dang / shin tu sbyangs ba'i bde ba so sor myong bar byed pas na /
analyzed: de de'i tshe na gzugs kyi lus dang / yid kyi lus kyis tshor ba'i bde ba dang / shin tu sbyangs ba'i bde ba so sor myong bar byed pas na /
translated: that at that time he experiences the happiness of feeling and the happiness of pliancy with the body of form and the body of thought.

original: de'i phyir bde ba lus kyis myong ba zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba lus kyis myong ba zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “he experiences happiness with the body.”

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de la dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas ba btang snyoms ba'o zhes brjod pa ste zhes bya ni bsam gtan gsum pa man chad la ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de la dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas ba btang snyoms ba'o zhes brjod pa ste zhes bya ni bsam gtan gsum pa man chad la ni /
translated: “The noble ones declare that he is mindful and experiences happiness, and is in a state of neutral feeling” means that in the third meditative absorption and below,

original: bde ba de lta bu yang med la rgyun du btang snyoms la gnas pa med do //
analyzed: bde ba de lta bu yang med la rgyun du btang snyoms la gnas pa med do //
translated: there is no such happiness, and there is no continuous state of neutral feeling.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i gong ma dag la ni btang snyoms yod kyang bde ba de lta bu med de /🔽de ltar 'og ma @171a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i gong ma dag la ni btang snyoms yod kyang bde ba de lta bu med de / de ltar 'og ma @171a * //
translated: Though equanimity exists above the third absorption, such pleasure does not exist.

original: dag la bde ba dang btang snyoms med pa dang / gong ma dag la bde ba med pa'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dag la bde ba dang btang snyoms med pa dang / gong ma dag la bde ba med pa'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus pleasure and equanimity do not exist below and pleasure does not exist above.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa 'di ni de dag gi gnas yin pas na /🔽'phags bas kyang de la dmigs te gnas pa'i gang zag gang yin pa de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa 'di ni de dag gi gnas yin pas na / 'phags bas kyang de la dmigs te gnas pa'i gang zag gang yin pa de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore this third absorption is the abode of both.

original: gang de dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod de /
analyzed: gang de dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod de /
translated: Aryas who focus on and abide in that are called those who possess mindfulness and abide in pleasure and equanimity.

original: 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams so //🔽dga' ba med ba zhes bya ba ni de ltar btang snyoms la gnas pa des des de'i che dran pa dang shes bzhin kun du bsten cing goms par byas /
analyzed: 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams so // dga' ba med ba zhes bya ba ni de ltar btang snyoms la gnas pa des des de'i che dran pa dang shes bzhin kun du bsten cing goms par byas /
translated: Aryas refers to buddhas and buddhas śrāvakas.

original: lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus /
analyzed: lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus /
translated: Those who are free of joy abide in equanimity and through the cause of relying on, cultivating and frequently engaging in mindfulness and introspection,🔽they are called those who possess mindfulness and abide in pleasure and equanimity.

original: dga' ba dang ldan pa'i tshor pas sems dga' bar byed pa de spong bar byed cing /
analyzed: dga' ba dang ldan pa'i tshor pas sems dga' bar byed pa de spong bar byed cing /
translated: He abandons the mental state that is accompanied by the feeling of joy.

original: dga' ba'i gnyen po dga' ba med pa zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi ba'i tshor ba'i sems las skyes par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: dga' ba'i gnyen po dga' ba med pa zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi ba'i tshor ba'i sems las skyes par 'gyur bas na /
translated: Since the mental state that is the antidote to joy is born from the feelings of equanimity, peace, and complete peace,

original: de'i phyir dga' ba med pa zhes bya gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dga' ba med pa zhes bya gsungs so //
translated: it is called “without joy.”

original: bsam gtan gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: He accomplishes and dwells in the third concentration.

original: de bde ba yang spangs te /🔽snga nas sdug bsngal yang sbangs shing yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba yang nub pas bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: de bde ba yang spangs te / snga nas sdug bsngal yang sbangs shing yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba yang nub pas bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: He abandons pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin /🔽btang snyoms dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin / btang snyoms dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te /
translated: Since he previously abandoned suffering, and since joy and sorrow have already subsided, he is neither happy nor suffering.

original: gnas so zhes gsungs pa de la /🔽de bde ba yang spangs te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas so zhes gsungs pa de la / de bde ba yang spangs te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He accomplishes and dwells in the fourth concentration, which is complete equanimity and pure mindfulness.🔽He abandons pleasure.

original: bde ba'i gnyen po ni rigs 'dra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba'i gnyen po ni rigs 'dra ba'i phyir /
translated: Since the antidote to pleasure is of a similar type,

original: spong ba'i gnyen po ma bstan par de'i gnyen pos byas pa bad ba spangs pa gang yin pa de nyid brten te /
analyzed: spong ba'i gnyen po ma bstan par de'i gnyen pos byas pa bad ba spangs pa gang yin pa de nyid brten te /
translated: Without teaching the antidote of abandonment, whatever abandonment of pleasure is made by its antidote is itself relied upon.

original: de'i gnyen po yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is its antidote?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin yin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin yin no //
translated: equanimity, mindfulness, and introspection.

original: de dag la brten cing goms par byas pas /
analyzed: de dag la brten cing goms par byas pas /
translated: Relying on those and cultivating them,

original: bsam gtan gsum pa las bskyed cing /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa las bskyed cing /
translated: he generates the third concentration

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de spong bar byed pas na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de spong bar byed pas na /
translated: and abandons the pleasure of the third concentration level.

original: de'i phyir de bde ba yang spangs te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bde ba yang spangs te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “he also abandons pleasure.”

original: snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba yang nub pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba yang nub pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Previously, he abandoned suffering and the joy and sorrow of the third concentration level have already subsided.

original: de'i tshe na bsam gtan pa des bde ba dang / sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'das pa'i rjes su thob cing /
analyzed: de'i tshe na bsam gtan pa des bde ba dang / sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'das pa'i rjes su thob cing /
translated: At that time, the meditator attains the state that is beyond both pleasure and suffering.

original: des sngon spangs pa gang yin pa dang / da ltar spong @171b bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag gcig tu bsdus pas na /
analyzed: des sngon spangs pa gang yin pa dang / da ltar spong @171b bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag gcig tu bsdus pas na /
translated: Because he combines what was previously abandoned and what is now abandoned,

original: de'i phyir snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba yang nub pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba yang nub pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: therefore it is said, “previously he abandoned suffering and now pleasure and pain have subsided.”

original: de la bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na ni bde ba spangs so //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na ni bde ba spangs so //
translated: At the time of entering the fourth absorption, he abandons pleasure.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na ni sdug bsngal spangs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na ni sdug bsngal spangs so //
translated: At the time of entering the second absorption, he abandons pain.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na ni yid bde ba nub po //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na ni yid bde ba nub po //
translated: At the time of entering the third absorption, mental pleasure subsides.

original: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na ni yid mi bde ba nub po //🔽bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na ni yid mi bde ba nub po // bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: At the time of entering the first absorption, mental pain subsides.🔽As for neither pleasure nor pain,

original: des re zhig bde ba dang sdug bsngal spangs pa'i phyir de la tshor ba'i lhag ma bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: des re zhig bde ba dang sdug bsngal spangs pa'i phyir de la tshor ba'i lhag ma bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: because he has already abandoned pleasure and pain, the remaining feeling is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa nyi tshe yod pas na /🔽de'i phyir bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa nyi tshe yod pas na / de'i phyir bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: Since only the neither-painful-nor-pleasant exists,

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: therefore it is said to be neither pleasant nor painful.

original: btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Complete purity of equanimity and complete purity of mindfulness

original: des de'i tshe na bsam gtan dang po yan chad kyi sa 'og ma'i skyon 'di lta ste /
analyzed: des de'i tshe na bsam gtan dang po yan chad kyi sa 'og ma'i skyon 'di lta ste /
translated: means that at that time, all the faults of the lower levels up to and including the first meditative concentration,

original: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba thams cad spangs par gyur cing /
analyzed: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba thams cad spangs par gyur cing /
translated: such as investigation, analysis, joy, inhalation, and exhalation, are abandoned.

original: de dag spangs pa'i phyir de la btang snyoms dang dran pa gang yod pa de yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su byang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag spangs pa'i phyir de la btang snyoms dang dran pa gang yod pa de yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su byang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Since they are abandoned, the equanimity and mindfulness that exist there become completely pure and completely cleansed.

original: des na bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms bar zhugs pa de'i sems de mi g-yo bar gnas shing /
analyzed: des na bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms bar zhugs pa de'i sems de mi g-yo bar gnas shing /
translated: Therefore, the mind of one who has entered the fourth meditative concentration abides without movement.

original: g-yo ba thams cad dang bral bas na /
analyzed: g-yo ba thams cad dang bral bas na /
translated: Since it is free from all movement,

original: de'i phyir btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “complete purity of equanimity and mindfulness.”

original: de la bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te /
translated: Therein, having accomplished the fourth meditative concentration,

original: gnas so zhes bya ba ni /🔽bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa snga ma dag la ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya'o /
analyzed: gnas so zhes bya ba ni / bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa snga ma dag la ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya'o /
translated: he abides.

original: // / nyan thos kyi sa bam po bco brgyad pa /
analyzed: // / nyan thos kyi sa bam po bco brgyad pa /
translated: This should be understood as it was previously explained in the context of the first meditative concentration and so on.

original: de rnam pa tham cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa tham cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Having completely transcended the perceptions of physical form,

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing ;
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing ;
translated: the perceptions of obstruction having disappeared,

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas /
translated: not attending to the perception of multiplicity,

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas /
translated: thinking “space is infinite,”

original: nam mkha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: nam mkha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa de la /
translated: he accomplishes and abides in the sphere of infinite space.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du zhes rnams las yang dag par 'das te zhes bya ba @172a * //🔽ni nam mkha' mos bar byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du zhes rnams las yang dag par 'das te zhes bya ba @172a * //🔽ni nam mkha' mos bar byed pa'i phyir //
translated: Therein, having completely transcended the perceptions of physical form,🔽he completely transcends the perceptions of physical form means that he transcends the perception of physical form by means of the sphere of infinite space.

original: kha dog sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang ldan pa'i 'du shes de dag ni mi snang zhing skyo la 'dod chags dang bral bas yang dag par 'das pas na /
analyzed: kha dog sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang ldan pa'i 'du shes de dag ni mi snang zhing skyo la 'dod chags dang bral bas yang dag par 'das pas na /
translated: The discriminations of blue, yellow, red, and white do not appear to him, and because he is disgusted with them and free from attachment, he has transcended them.

original: de'i phyir de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “he has completely transcended all discriminations of form.”

original: thos pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par 'gyur cing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thos pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par 'gyur cing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The discriminations of hearing have disappeared” means

original: de de dag las yang dag par 'das shing mi snang bar gyur pa'i rgyus kha dog bsags pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i sgrib ba'i 'du shes rnam pa du ma rnam pa sna tshogs mang po dag dang bral bas na /
analyzed: de de dag las yang dag par 'das shing mi snang bar gyur pa'i rgyus kha dog bsags pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i sgrib ba'i 'du shes rnam pa du ma rnam pa sna tshogs mang po dag dang bral bas na /
translated: that because he has transcended them and they no longer appear, he is free from the many kinds of discriminations that are the cause of the accumulation of colors and the cause of the obscurations.

original: de'i phyir thogs pa'i 'du shes nub par gyur cing zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir thogs pa'i 'du shes nub par gyur cing zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “the discriminations of obstruction have disappeared.”

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “He does not pay attention to the discriminations of multiplicity” means🔽that

original: de de dag dang bral bas thogs pa khyad par can rnam pa sna tshogs pa de dag nyid la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de de dag dang bral bas thogs pa khyad par can rnam pa sna tshogs pa de dag nyid la 'di lta ste /
translated: Since he is free from those, he does not have the various kinds of special obstructions.

original: zas dang / skom dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / rgyan dang ; gnas dang / skyed mos tshal dang / nags tshal dang / dmag dang / ri la sogs par bye bar 'dogs pa'i 'du shes 'jug pa gang yin pa'i 'du shes de dag de rnams la gtad kyang rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du de la 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas na /

analyzed: 'du shes med pa 'di ni zhi ba'o // 'di ni gya nom pa'o zhes bya ba ni / 'du shes la mi @174a * //
translated: the pacification of perception, the sublimity of perception.

original: phyogs pa'i yid la byed pa yongs su bzung nas /
analyzed: phyogs pa'i yid la byed pa yongs su bzung nas /
translated: This is the way to take up the attention that turns away from perception.

original: 'du shes byung ngo cog la dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes byung ngo cog la dran pa med pa dang / yid la byed pa med par byed pa ste /
translated: He does not have any perception whatsoever, nor does he have any attention.

original: des de bsgoms pa'i rgyus na /
analyzed: des de bsgoms pa'i rgyus na /
translated: By the cause of his cultivation of that,

original: sbyor ba'i lam la ni sems dang bcas ba'i gnas skabs su 'gyur la /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam la ni sems dang bcas ba'i gnas skabs su 'gyur la /
translated: in the path of application, he has a state with mind.

original: snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu ni sems 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu ni sems 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Immediately after entering meditative attainment, the mind does not arise.

original: de ltar nges par 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba yid la byed pas /🔽dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral la /
analyzed: de ltar nges par 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba yid la byed pas / dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral la /
translated: Thus, through attention that precedes the discernment of definite deliverance,🔽those who are free from attachment to the desire realm of the brhatphala gods🔽but are not free from attachment to the desire realm of the sudarsana gods

original: 'bras bu tsha ba dag gi 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams su 'gog pa gang yin pa de na /
analyzed: 'bras bu tsha ba dag gi 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams su 'gog pa gang yin pa de na /
translated: cease the mind and mental factors.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the meditative attainment of nondiscernment.

original: de ni de ltar 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni de ltar 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is obtained in that way.

original: de la 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched thob pa'i 'phags pa mchog tu zhi ba'i gnas pas gnas par 'dod pa /
analyzed: de la 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched thob pa'i 'phags pa mchog tu zhi ba'i gnas pas gnas par 'dod pa /
translated: Regarding that, āryas who obtain the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment and who wish to abide in the state of supreme peace

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las sems bskyod par byed cing ;
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las sems bskyod par byed cing ;
translated: move the mind from the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment.

original: de'i sems de de las bskyod pa na dmigs pa mi rnyed de /
analyzed: de'i sems de de las bskyod pa na dmigs pa mi rnyed de /
translated: When their mind moves from that, they do not find an object.

original: ma rnyed na 'gag cing 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: ma rnyed na 'gag cing 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: Thinking that when it is not found, it ceases and does not arise,

original: de ltar ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i slob pa'am dgra bcom pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: de ltar ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i slob pa'am dgra bcom pa yang rung ste /
translated: Thus, a learner or an arhat who is free from attachment to the base of nothingness🔽ceases the mind and mental factors by means of attention that is preceded by the discernment of abiding.

original: gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'gog pa gnag yin pa de ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ste /🔽de ni 'di ltar thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'gog pa gnag yin pa de ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ste / de ni 'di ltar thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is called the meditative attainment of cessation and it is attained in this way.

original: de la bsam gtan la brten nas mngon par shes pa lnga mngon par 'grub par 'grub te /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan la brten nas mngon par shes pa lnga mngon par 'grub par 'grub te /
translated: The five higher perceptions are accomplished in dependence on the absorptions.

original: ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: How are they accomplished?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The absorptions are as follows:🔽A meditator who obtains pure absorption

original: bsam gtan pa bsam gtan yongs su dag pa thob pa de bsam gtan yongs su dag pa de la brten nas des 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa bsam gtan yongs su dag pa thob pa de bsam gtan yongs su dag pa de la brten nas des 'di lta ste /
translated: in dependence on that pure absorption,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul lam /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul lam /
translated: he begins with the object of supernatural power,

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'am /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'am /
translated: the recollection of past lives,

original: lha'i rnam ba'am /
analyzed: lha'i rnam ba'am /
translated: the divine eye,

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa'am /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa'am /
translated: the knowledge of death and rebirth,

original: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa las brtsams te ;
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa las brtsams te ;
translated: and the knowledge of the classes of consciousness.

original: mngon par shes pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos thos pa dang / bzung ba dang / kun chub par byas pa gang yin pa de nyid mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa ba'i yid la byed pas yid la byed pa na /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos thos pa dang / bzung ba dang / kun chub par byas pa gang yin pa de nyid mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa ba'i yid la byed pas yid la byed pa na /
translated: When he attends to the Dharma that he has heard, retained, and mastered through the power of superknowledge, with attention that is a level of concentration,

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur te /
translated: he attains the correct understanding of meaning and the correct understanding of phenomena.

original: don so so yang @174b dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig bar gyur pa des /
analyzed: don so so yang @174b dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig bar gyur pa des /
translated: Through the attainment of the correct understanding of meaning and the correct understanding of phenomena,🔽he repeatedly and continuously directs his mind in that way.

original: de ltar de ltar sems mngon par 'dus byas shing lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus na /
analyzed: de ltar de ltar sems mngon par 'dus byas shing lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus na /
translated: Because of the cause of repeatedly and continuously directing his mind in that way,

original: de'i bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu mngon par shes pa lnga 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dus kyang yod skabs kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu mngon par shes pa lnga 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dus kyang yod skabs kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: there is an occasion and a time when the five superknowledges, which are the result of cultivation, arise for him.

original: gzhan yang de ltar don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig par gyur pa de /
analyzed: gzhan yang de ltar don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig par gyur pa de /
translated: Moreover, when he attains the correct understanding of meaning and the correct understanding of phenomena in that way,

original: mngon par shes pa thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir 'du shes rnam pa bcu gnyis sgom par byed de /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir 'du shes rnam pa bcu gnyis sgom par byed de /
translated: In order to manifest all the superknowledges, they cultivate twelve kinds of perception.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: yang ba'i 'du shes dang / 'jam pa'i 'du shes dang / nam mkha'i khams kyi 'du shes dang / sems dang lus phrad pa'i 'du shes dang / mos pa'i 'du shes dang / snon spyad pa nyams su mongs ba'i go rims rjes su dran pa'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: yang ba'i 'du shes dang / 'jam pa'i 'du shes dang / nam mkha'i khams kyi 'du shes dang / sems dang lus phrad pa'i 'du shes dang / mos pa'i 'du shes dang / snon spyad pa nyams su mongs ba'i go rims rjes su dran pa'i 'du shes dang /
translated: the perception of lightness, the perception of softness, the perception of the space element, the perception of the contact of mind and body, the perception of aspiration, the perception of the order of the practice of the superknowledges,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs 'das pa'i sgra skad kyi 'du shes dang / snang ba'i gzugs kyi mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / nyon mongs pas byas pa'i gzugs rnam par 'gyur ba'i 'du shes dang / rnam par thar pa'i 'du shes dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes dang /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs 'das pa'i sgra skad kyi 'du shes dang / snang ba'i gzugs kyi mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / nyon mongs pas byas pa'i gzugs rnam par 'gyur ba'i 'du shes dang / rnam par thar pa'i 'du shes dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes dang /
translated: the perception of the various sounds of the past, the perception of the signs of visible forms, the perception of the transformation of forms made by afflictions, the perception of liberation, the perception of the bases of mastery,

original: zad par gyi skye mched kyi 'du shes so //
analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched kyi 'du shes so //
translated: and the perception of the bases of totality.

original: de la yang ba'i 'du shes ni 'du shes gang gis bdag nyid kyi lus 'di lta ste dper na shing bal gyi 'da' ba'am /🔽ras bal gyi 'da' ba'am /
analyzed: de la yang ba'i 'du shes ni 'du shes gang gis bdag nyid kyi lus 'di lta ste dper na shing bal gyi 'da' ba'am / ras bal gyi 'da' ba'am /
translated: The notion of lightness is the notion by which one's body is like cotton wool, or like cotton.🔽🔽

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor ltar yang bar mos par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor ltar yang bar mos par byed pa ste /
translated: The notion of lightness is the notion by which one imagines one’s body to be light, like cotton fluff, or like a spider’s thread, or like the circle of wind.

original: de de ltar mos par byed pa na /
analyzed: de de ltar mos par byed pa na /
translated: When one imagines it in this way,

original: mos pa las byung ba kho na'i yid la byed pas bdag nyid kyi lus 'di lta ste /🔽khri'i steng nas khri'u'i steng du 'am /
analyzed: mos pa las byung ba kho na'i yid la byed pas bdag nyid kyi lus 'di lta ste / khri'i steng nas khri'u'i steng du 'am /
translated: one imagines that one’s body is moved by a mental attention that is merely a matter of imagination,🔽from a couch to a stool,

original: khri'u'i steng nas khri'i steng du'am /🔽de bzhin du khri'i steng nas rtsva bting ba'i steng du'am /
analyzed: khri'u'i steng nas khri'i steng du'am / de bzhin du khri'i steng nas rtsva bting ba'i steng du'am /
translated: from a stool to a couch,🔽from a couch to a spread of grass,

original: rtsva bting ba'i steng nas khri'i steng de dang de dag tu 'dod bar byed do //🔽de la 'jam pa'i 'du shes ni /
analyzed: rtsva bting ba'i steng nas khri'i steng de dang de dag tu 'dod bar byed do // de la 'jam pa'i 'du shes ni /
translated: from a spread of grass to a couch.

original: 'du shes gang gis bdag gnyid kyi lus 'di lha ste /🔽dper na / shing bal lam /
analyzed: 'du shes gang gis bdag gnyid kyi lus 'di lha ste / dper na / shing bal lam /
translated: The notion of softness is the notion by which one imagines one’s body to be soft,

original: srin bal lam /🔽dar ltar 'jam par mos par byed pa ste /
analyzed: srin bal lam /🔽dar ltar 'jam par mos par byed pa ste /
translated: like cotton, or like silk, or like wool.

original: de ltar na 'dzam pa'i 'du shes 'di ni yang ba'i 'du shes gso bar byed pa dang / rjes su 'dzin par byed pa yin pas des rjes su zin na yang ba'i 'du shes kyang 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dzam pa'i 'du shes 'di ni yang ba'i 'du shes gso bar byed pa dang / rjes su 'dzin par byed pa yin pas des rjes su zin na yang ba'i 'du shes kyang 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the perception of lightness is the nurse and the attendant of the perception of buoyancy. If it is attended to, the perception of lightness will also increase, expand, and broaden.

original: de la nam mkha'i khams kyi 'du shes ni /
analyzed: de la nam mkha'i khams kyi 'du shes ni /
translated: The perception of the space element is as follows.

original: @175a * // 'du shes gang gis bdag nyid kyi lus yang ba nyid dang / 'jam pa nyid du mos par byas nas /
analyzed: @175a * // 'du shes gang gis bdag nyid kyi lus yang ba nyid dang / 'jam pa nyid du mos par byas nas /
translated: By means of this perception, one imagines that one’s body is light and soft.

original: gal te gang du 'gro 'dod pa'i bra den 'gro ba la bar chad byed pa'i gzugs kyi rnam pas chod pa de la mos pa las byung ba kho na'i yid la byed pas nam mkhar mos par /
analyzed: gal te gang du 'gro 'dod pa'i bra den 'gro ba la bar chad byed pa'i gzugs kyi rnam pas chod pa de la mos pa las byung ba kho na'i yid la byed pas nam mkhar mos par /
translated: If there is an obstacle to going to a place that one wishes to go, by means of attention that is only arisen from resolve, one resolves that the form that is the obstacle is space.

original: byed pa'o // de la sems dang lus phrad pa'i 'du shes ni /
analyzed: byed pa'o // de la sems dang lus phrad pa'i 'du shes ni /
translated: The perception of the contact of mind and body is as follows.

original: 'du shes gang gis sems la lus gnas par gtod pa dang / lus la sems gnas par gtod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes gang gis sems la lus gnas par gtod pa dang / lus la sems gnas par gtod par byed pa ste /
translated: By means of this perception, one focuses the mind on the body and focuses the body on the mind.

original: des ni de'i lus shin yang ba dang / shin tu 'jam pa dang / shin tu las su rung ba dang / shin tu 'od gsal ba dang / sems kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / sems dang 'brel ba dang / sems la rten cing 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni de'i lus shin yang ba dang / shin tu 'jam pa dang / shin tu las su rung ba dang / shin tu 'od gsal ba dang / sems kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / sems dang 'brel ba dang / sems la rten cing 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this, his body becomes very light, very soft, very workable, very bright, following the mind, connected with the mind, and engaged in support of the mind.

original: de la mos pa'i 'du shes ni /
analyzed: de la mos pa'i 'du shes ni /
translated: Among them, the perception of resolve is as follows.

original: 'du shes gang gis rgyang ring po la thag nye ba dang / thag nye ba la rgyang ring po dang / phra mo la rags pa dang / rags pa la phra mo dang / sa la chu dang / chu la sa dang / de bzhin du 'byung ba chen po re re yang gcig la gcig 'khrul par rgya cher mos par byed pa dang /

original: de bzhin du sprul pa gzugs sprul pa dang / sgra sprul pa dang / sprul pa'i sgra la mos par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sprul pa gzugs sprul pa dang / sgra sprul pa dang / sprul pa'i sgra la mos par byed pa ste /
translated: And similarly, one resolves on emanations, on emanated forms, on emanated sounds, and on the sounds of emanations.

original: 'du shes rnam pa lnga po de dag bsgom shing yongs su grub pa dag gis rdzu 'phrul gyi yul rnam pa du ma nyams su myong par 'gyur te /🔽'di lta ste /

original: lus kyis thogs pa med par rtsig pa la yang thad kar 'gro ba dang / ra ba la yang thad kar 'gro ba dang / ril yang thad kar 'gro ba dang / sa la yang 'di lta ste /
