analyzed: de goms par byas pa'i rgyus bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rnam pa dang bcas yul phyogs dang bcas pa'i bar du rgya cher yang dag par rjes su dran no //
translated: By the cause of cultivating that, the result of cultivation is the ability to recollect in great detail the various former abodes, with their aspects and their locations.

original: de la rnam pa sna tshogs 'dus ba'i sgra skad kyi 'du shes ni grong ngam /
analyzed: de la rnam pa sna tshogs 'dus ba'i sgra skad kyi 'du shes ni grong ngam /
translated: The various sounds and voices that are heard are the sounds and voices of the various groups of people who gather in a town or

original: grong rdal lam /
analyzed: grong rdal lam /
translated: a city,

original: bzo sbyangs kyi gnas sam /🔽'dren ma'i nang ngam /
analyzed: bzo sbyangs kyi gnas sam / 'dren ma'i nang ngam /
translated: in a place where crafts are practiced,

original: 'khor gyi nang ngam /🔽khang khyim chu zheng gab pa'am /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang ngam / khang khyim chu zheng gab pa'am /
translated: in a marketplace,🔽in an assembly,🔽in a house with many rooms,

original: gnas khang gang du skye bo'i tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs 'du te 'khod pa de dag gi sgra skad 'dren ma sna tshogs 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gnas khang gang du skye bo'i tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs 'du te 'khod pa de dag gi sgra skad 'dren ma sna tshogs 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: or in any other place where various groups of people gather and sit.

original: de ni klag cor gyi sgra zhe kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de ni klag cor gyi sgra zhe kyang bya'o //
translated: Those are also called “the sounds of babble and chatter.”

original: yang na chu klung chen po 'bab pa'i sgra yang rung ste /
analyzed: yang na chu klung chen po 'bab pa'i sgra yang rung ste /
translated: Or it may be the sound of a great river flowing.

original: de la 'du shes bsgom pa gang yin pa'i mtshan ma bzung nas /
analyzed: de la 'du shes bsgom pa gang yin pa'i mtshan ma bzung nas /
translated: In that case, having taken up the meditation on the perception of that sound,

original: mnam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pa des dbus dang / mtha' 'khob pa dang / lha dang / mi'i sgra rgyab ring po dag dang / thag nye ba dag la sems gtod par byed do //
analyzed: mnam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pa des dbus dang / mtha' 'khob pa dang / lha dang / mi'i sgra rgyab ring po dag dang / thag nye ba dag la sems gtod par byed do //
translated: By means of this attention to the earth element, he focuses his mind on the sounds of the central region, the sounds of the border regions, the sounds of gods, and the sounds of humans, whether distant or nearby.

original: de lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu lha'i rna ba lha'i rna ba thob par 'gyur @176a * //
analyzed: de lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu lha'i rna ba lha'i rna ba thob par 'gyur @176a * //
translated: By frequently practicing this, he attains the divine ear as the result of his cultivation.

original: te ; des ni lha dang mi'i sgra rgyang ring po gang dag yin pa dang / thag nye ba gang dag yin pa rnams kyang thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: te ; des ni lha dang mi'i sgra rgyang ring po gang dag yin pa dang / thag nye ba gang dag yin pa rnams kyang thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: With this divine ear, he hears the sounds of gods and humans, whether distant or nearby.

original: de la snang ba'i gzugs kyi mtshan ma'i 'du shes ni /
analyzed: de la snang ba'i gzugs kyi mtshan ma'i 'du shes ni /
translated: The perception of the signs of visible forms as light🔽is as follows:

original: snga ma bzhin du snang ba'i mtshan ma bzung nas /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du snang ba'i mtshan ma bzung nas /
translated: Having apprehended the signs of light as before,

original: mtshan ma de nyid yid la byed pa dang / dge pa dang mi dge ba'i las byed pa la sogs pa bye brag gi sems can sna tshogs su gyur pa dag las mchan ma bzung nas /
analyzed: mtshan ma de nyid yid la byed pa dang / dge pa dang mi dge ba'i las byed pa la sogs pa bye brag gi sems can sna tshogs su gyur pa dag las mchan ma bzung nas /
translated: he focuses his mind on those signs and, having apprehended the signs of various sentient beings, such as those who are virtuous or non-virtuous, and so on,

original: mtshan ma de nyid yid la byed ba gang yin pa de ni snang ba'i gzugs kyi mtshan ma'i 'du shes zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma de nyid yid la byed ba gang yin pa de ni snang ba'i gzugs kyi mtshan ma'i 'du shes zhes bya ste /
translated: The attention to those signs is called the discernment of the sign of the form of appearance.

original: de goms par byas pa'i rgyus bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de goms par byas pa'i rgyus bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Through the cause of cultivating that, one attains the result of meditation, knowledge of death and rebirth.

original: lha'i mig rnam par dag pa des ni lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i mig rnam par dag pa des ni lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of that pure divine eye, one sees in detail that after the body is destroyed and one dies, one is born among the gods in the happy realms of the higher realms.

original: de la nyon mongs pas byas pa'i gzugs rnam par 'gyur ba'i 'du shes ni ;
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pas byas pa'i gzugs rnam par 'gyur ba'i 'du shes ni ;
translated: Discernment of the change in form due to affliction is as follows.

original: 'du shes gang gis chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / rmongs pa dang / khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa dang / yongs su gdung ba dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: 'du shes gang gis chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / rmongs pa dang / khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa dang / yongs su gdung ba dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: “What are the perceptions? They are the perceptions of attachment, anger, delusion, rage, resentment, concealment, distress, deceit, dishonesty, shamelessness, and lack of embarrassment.🔽They are the perceptions of the mental states of the afflictions and

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams kyi gzugs kyi gnas skabs la nye bar rtog par byed cing yongs su gcod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams kyi gzugs kyi gnas skabs la nye bar rtog par byed cing yongs su gcod par byed pa ste /
translated: secondary afflictions of sentient beings.

original: chags par byed pa'i gzugs rnam par gyur pa'i gzugs kyi gnas skabs ni 'di lta bu yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: chags par byed pa'i gzugs rnam par gyur pa'i gzugs kyi gnas skabs ni 'di lta bu yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: “The condition of the form of those who are attached is as follows:

original: dbang po rgod pa dang / dbang po 'dam bu ltar mthong ba dang / bzhin 'dzum par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rgod pa dang / dbang po 'dam bu ltar mthong ba dang / bzhin 'dzum par byed pa yin no //
translated: Their eyes are restless, their eyes are like a swamp, and they smile with their faces.

original: zhe sdang bar gyur pa'i gzugs rnam par gyur pa'i gzugs kyi gnas skabs ni 'di lta bu yin te /
analyzed: zhe sdang bar gyur pa'i gzugs rnam par gyur pa'i gzugs kyi gnas skabs ni 'di lta bu yin te /
translated: “The condition of the form of those who are angry is as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bzhin gyi mdog gyur pa dang / skad 'dar 'dar por gyur pa dang / khro gnyer 'dus par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhin gyi mdog gyur pa dang / skad 'dar 'dar por gyur pa dang / khro gnyer 'dus par gyur pa yin no //
translated: one’s facial expression changes, one’s voice trembles, and one’s face becomes wrinkled.

original: rmongs par gyur pa'i gzugs rnam par gyur pa'i gzugs kyi gnas skabs ni 'di lta bu yin te /
analyzed: rmongs par gyur pa'i gzugs rnam par gyur pa'i gzugs kyi gnas skabs ni 'di lta bu yin te /
translated: This is the type of physical state that occurs when one is confused.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽lkugs pa dang / don nges par brtags pa brda mi phrad pa dang / phal ba'i tshig rjod par byed pa yin no zhes de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa'i rnam pa dag dang / ngo tsha med pa @176b dang ; khrel med pa'i bar gyis kun nas dkris par gyur pa'i gzugs rnam par gyur pa /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / lkugs pa dang / don nges par brtags pa brda mi phrad pa dang / phal ba'i tshig rjod par byed pa yin no zhes de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa'i rnam pa dag dang / ngo tsha med pa @176b dang ; khrel med pa'i bar gyis kun nas dkris par gyur pa'i gzugs rnam par gyur pa /
translated: It is as follows:🔽one is mute, one does not understand the meaning of what is being said, and one speaks in a way that is inappropriate for a noble person.

original: gzugs kyi gnas skabs gang dag yin pa de dag las mtshan ma bzung nas /
analyzed: gzugs kyi gnas skabs gang dag yin pa de dag las mtshan ma bzung nas /
translated: In this way, one should apprehend the signs of the physical states that are associated with the forms of shamelessness and absence of abashment that are similar to those that were described previously.

original: mtshan ma de nyid yid la byed cing /
analyzed: mtshan ma de nyid yid la byed cing /
translated: One should then bring to mind those very signs.

original: de la lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa 'byung ba 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa 'byung ba 'gyur te /
translated: Through frequently engaging in this practice, the knowledge of the diversity of minds arises as the result of meditation.

original: des ni sems can pha rol dang gang zag pha rol rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa'i yid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽de la rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched kyi 'du shes bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: des ni sems can pha rol dang gang zag pha rol rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa'i yid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // de la rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched kyi 'du shes bsgom pa ni /
translated: By this, they know the thoughts and mental activity of other sentient beings and other persons just as they are.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The cultivation of the perception of the liberations, the bases of subjugation, and the bases of totality is as follows.

original: sngar mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i skabs su bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya ste de dag bsgoms pas ni /
analyzed: sngar mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i skabs su bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya ste de dag bsgoms pas ni /
translated: It should be understood as taught in the context of the stage of meditative equipoise above.

original: 'phags pa'i rdzu 'phrul dngos po sgyur ba dang / sprul pa dang / mos pa dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rdzu 'phrul dngos po sgyur ba dang / sprul pa dang / mos pa dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: By cultivating those, they attain the noble supernatural powers of transformation, emanation, and resolve.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: They attain the absence of conflict, knowledge through prayer, and the four analytical knowledges.

original: chos so sor yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa dang mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro ;🔽/ de la 'phags pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i rdzu 'phrul la bye brag ni 'di yod do //
analyzed: chos so sor yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa dang mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro ; / de la 'phags pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i rdzu 'phrul la bye brag ni 'di yod do //
translated: The four analytical knowledges are the analytical knowledge of the teachings, the analytical knowledge of meanings, the analytical knowledge of clear glancing, and the analytical knowledge of inspired speech.

original: 'phags pa'i rdzu 'phrul ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rdzu 'phrul ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There is a difference between the supernormal knowledge of the noble ones and that of the non-noble ones.

original: dngos po gang dang gang sgyur bar mdzad pa dang / sprul pa gang dang / gang sprul bar mdzad pa dang / gang dag gang la mos par mdzad pa de dang de dag thams cad gzhan du mi 'gyur zhing de lta bu kho na yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gang dang gang sgyur bar mdzad pa dang / sprul pa gang dang / gang sprul bar mdzad pa dang / gang dag gang la mos par mdzad pa de dang de dag thams cad gzhan du mi 'gyur zhing de lta bu kho na yin te /
translated: The supernormal knowledge of the noble ones is such that whatever they transform, whatever they emanate, whatever they intend, all that is just so and not otherwise.

original: de dag gis bya ba byed nus pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis bya ba byed nus pa yin no //
translated: It is capable of performing its function.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i rdzu 'phrul ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i rdzu 'phrul ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The supernormal knowledge of the non-noble ones is not like that.

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa bzhin du snang ba tsam du ston par zad do //
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa bzhin du snang ba tsam du ston par zad do //
translated: It is just a display, like the emanation of a magician.

original: de ltar 'du shes bcu gnyis po de dag kun du brten cing goms par byas /🔽lan mang du byas na /
analyzed: de ltar 'du shes bcu gnyis po de dag kun du brten cing goms par byas / lan mang du byas na /
translated: Thus, if one relies on, cultivates, and increases these twelve perceptions,🔽one will attain the five supernormal powers,

original: 'di lta ste mngon par shes pa lnga po dag ci rigs par 'thob pa dang / 'phags pa rnams kyi yon tan so so skye bo dang thun mong ma yin ba dag kyang ci rigs pa mngon par 'grub par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mngon par shes pa lnga po dag ci rigs par 'thob pa dang / 'phags pa rnams kyi yon tan so so skye bo dang thun mong ma yin ba dag kyang ci rigs pa mngon par 'grub par rig par bya'o //
translated: and will also accomplish the qualities of the noble ones that are not shared with ordinary beings.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po dang chung ngu dang / @177a * //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po dang chung ngu dang / @177a * //
translated: If one cultivates the first meditative concentration in small,

original: 'bring dang / chen por bsgoms na /
analyzed: 'bring dang / chen por bsgoms na /
translated: medium, and great [degrees],

original: tshangs rigs dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs chen gyi lha rnams dang ci rigs par skal pa mnyam par skye'o //
analyzed: tshangs rigs dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs chen gyi lha rnams dang ci rigs par skal pa mnyam par skye'o //
translated: one will be reborn in the Heaven of the Brahmapurohita gods, the Heaven of the Brahmakayika gods, and the Heaven of the Mahabrahma gods, respectively.🔽If one cultivates the second meditative concentration in small,

original: bsam gtan gnyis ba chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen por bsgoms na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis ba chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen por bsgoms na /
translated: medium, and great [degrees],

original: 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal gyi lha rnams dang ci rigs par skal pa mnyam par skye'o //
analyzed: 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal gyi lha rnams dang ci rigs par skal pa mnyam par skye'o //
translated: one will be reborn in the Heaven of Little Light, the Heaven of Immeasurable Light, and the Heaven of Luminous Light, respectively.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por bsgoms na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por bsgoms na /
translated: If one cultivates the third concentration as small, medium, and great,

original: dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas kyi lha rnams dang ci rigs par skal pa mnyam par skye'o //
analyzed: dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas kyi lha rnams dang ci rigs par skal pa mnyam par skye'o //
translated: one will be born in the god realms of Parittabha, Apramanabha, and Abhasvara, respectively.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por bsgoms na /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por bsgoms na /
translated: If one cultivates the fourth concentration as small, medium, and great,

original: sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dang / 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams dang ci rigs par skal pa mnyam par skye'o //
analyzed: sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dang / 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams dang ci rigs par skal pa mnyam par skye'o //
translated: one will be born in the god realms of Avriha, Atapas, and Sudrsa, respectively.

original: gal te 'phags pa'i phyir mi 'ong bas zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan bzhi dang / zag pa dang bcas pa spel mar bsgom zhing de la yang /
analyzed: gal te 'phags pa'i phyir mi 'ong bas zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan bzhi dang / zag pa dang bcas pa spel mar bsgom zhing de la yang /
translated: If a noble nonreturner cultivates the four uncontaminated concentrations and the contaminated ones in alternation,

original: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / ches che ba dang / shin tu che bar bsgoms na /
analyzed: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / ches che ba dang / shin tu che bar bsgoms na /
translated: and if he cultivates them as small, medium, great, greater, and very great,

original: 'di lta ste gnas gtsang ma lnga po mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong dang / gya nom snang dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams dang ci rigs par skal ba mnyam par skye'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste gnas gtsang ma lnga po mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong dang / gya nom snang dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams dang ci rigs par skal ba mnyam par skye'o //
translated: They are born in the same circumstances as the gods of the five pure abodes: Aviha, Atappa, Sudassa, Sudassi, and Akanittha.

original: nam mkha' dang / rnam shes dang / ci yang med dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por bsgoms na yang nam mkha' dang / rnam shes dang / ci yang med dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha rnams dang skal pa mnyam par skye ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / rnam shes dang / ci yang med dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por bsgoms na yang nam mkha' dang / rnam shes dang / ci yang med dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha rnams dang skal pa mnyam par skye ste /
translated: If they cultivate the base of infinite space, the base of infinite consciousness, the base of nothingness, and the base of neither perception nor non-perception in a lesser, middling, or greater way, they are born in the same circumstances as the gods of the base of infinite space, the base of infinite consciousness, the base of nothingness, and the base of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: lha de dag ni gzugs med pas na de'i phyir de dag la gnas gzhan bye brag tu dbye ba ni med kyi /
analyzed: lha de dag ni gzugs med pas na de'i phyir de dag la gnas gzhan bye brag tu dbye ba ni med kyi /
translated: Since those gods are formless, there are no separate places for them.

original: gnas pa'i bye brag ni yod do //
analyzed: gnas pa'i bye brag ni yod do //
translated: However, there are differences in their abodes.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bsgoms na ni /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bsgoms na ni /
translated: If they cultivate the meditative absorption of non-perception,

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams dang skal pa mnyam par skye'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams dang skal pa mnyam par skye'o //
translated: He is reborn among the gods who are devoid of ideation.

original: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rtags gang zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rtags gang zhe na smras pa /
translated: What are the signs of being free from desire?

original: lus kyi las kyi mtha' brtan pa dang / dbang po mi g-yo ba dang / de'i spyod lam myur du mi 'jig pa dang / spyod lam gcig gis kyang yongs su skyo ba med cing /
analyzed: lus kyi las kyi mtha' brtan pa dang / dbang po mi g-yo ba dang / de'i spyod lam myur du mi 'jig pa dang / spyod lam gcig gis kyang yongs su skyo ba med cing /
translated: His physical actions are stable, his faculties are not agitated, his behavior is not quickly destroyed, and he is not exhausted by a single behavior.

original: dus yun ring du 'da' bar byed pa dang / spyod lam gzhan la myur du dga' bar mi @177b byed pa dang / tshig nyung ngu smra ba dang / rab tu zhi bar smra ba dang / bre mo gtam la mi dga' ba dang / 'du 'dzi la mi dga' ba dang /
analyzed: dus yun ring du 'da' bar byed pa dang / spyod lam gzhan la myur du dga' bar mi @177b byed pa dang / tshig nyung ngu smra ba dang / rab tu zhi bar smra ba dang / bre mo gtam la mi dga' ba dang / 'du 'dzi la mi dga' ba dang /
translated: He spends a long time in one behavior, he does not quickly take up another behavior, he speaks little, he speaks peacefully, he does not enjoy frivolous speech, he does not enjoy socializing,

original: de'i tshig brtan par 'byung ba dang / mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas gzugs so sor yang dag par rig par byed cing gzugs la 'dod chags kun du mi 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya so sor yang dag par rig par byed cing /
analyzed: de'i tshig brtan par 'byung ba dang / mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas gzugs so sor yang dag par rig par byed cing gzugs la 'dod chags kun du mi 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya so sor yang dag par rig par byed cing /
translated: The signs of being free from attachment are that one's speech is firm, one sees forms with the eyes and one discerns forms without attachment to forms arising, one discerns sounds, smells, tastes and textures without attachment to sounds, smells, tastes and textures arising,

original: reg bya'i bar la 'dod chags kun du mi 'byung ba dang / 'jigs pa med pa dang / blo zab pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa chen pos lus dang sems nye bar bskar pa dang / brnab sems med pa dang / 'khrug pa med pa dang /
analyzed: reg bya'i bar la 'dod chags kun du mi 'byung ba dang / 'jigs pa med pa dang / blo zab pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa chen pos lus dang sems nye bar bskar pa dang / brnab sems med pa dang / 'khrug pa med pa dang /
translated: one is fearless, one's mind is profound, one's body and mind are well nurtured by great pliancy, one is free of covetousness, one is free of agitation,🔽one is patient and one's mind is not disturbed by thoughts of desire and so on.

original: bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / de'i sems la 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas kun nas 'khrug pa med pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rtags rnams yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / de'i sems la 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas kun nas 'khrug pa med pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rtags rnams yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Those similar to those are the signs of being free from attachment.

original: de ni re zhig 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'gro ba'i rnam pa dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'gro ba'i rnam pa dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the classification of the aspects of the path of the world.

original: gal te de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'gro bar 'dod na ni /🔽'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag las brtsams nas dgra bcom pa nyid thob kyi bar du de la mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa la sogs pa nas sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed pa'i bar gyi yid la byed pa
analyzed: gal te de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'gro bar 'dod na ni / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag las brtsams nas dgra bcom pa nyid thob kyi bar du de la mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa la sogs pa nas sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed pa'i bar gyi yid la byed pa
translated: If one wishes to proceed by the supramundane path,

original: bdun po dag rim gyis 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdun po dag rim gyis 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: one begins with the four noble truths, and the seven attentions arise in order, from the attention of discernment of characteristics up to the attention of the fruit of culmination of practice.

original: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po mdor bstan pa dang / rgyas bar bshad pa dang bcas pa thos shing bzung la legs par bsgoms shing yid la byed pa'am /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po mdor bstan pa dang / rgyas bar bshad pa dang bcas pa thos shing bzung la legs par bsgoms shing yid la byed pa'am /
translated: One hears and retains the brief and extensive teachings on the four noble truths, and one properly meditates and attends to them.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi thob pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa la ni rnam pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi thob pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa la ni rnam pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: Or, if one is a yogi who has attained the actual basis of the absorptions and formless states, one has four aspects:

original: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa dang / stong pa'i rnam pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pas bden pa sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid so sor rig par byed do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa dang / stong pa'i rnam pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pas bden pa sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid so sor rig par byed do //
translated: He discerns the characteristics of the truth of suffering through the aspects of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: rnam pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: There are four aspects:

original: rgyu'i rnam pa dang / kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa dang / rab tu skye ba'i rnam pa dang / rkyen gyi rnam pas bden pa kun 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid so sor rig par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu'i rnam pa dang / kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa dang / rab tu skye ba'i rnam pa dang / rkyen gyi rnam pas bden pa kun 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid so sor rig par byed do //
translated: He discerns the characteristics of the truth of origination through the aspects of cause, origination, successive arising, and condition.

original: rnam pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /🔽'gog pa'i rnam pa dang / zhi ba'i rnam pa dang / gya nom pa'i rnam pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i @178a * //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po 'di lta ste / 'gog pa'i rnam pa dang / zhi ba'i rnam pa dang / gya nom pa'i rnam pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i @178a * //
translated: There are four aspects:

original: rnam pas bden pa 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid so sor rig par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pas bden pa 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid so sor rig par byed do //
translated: He discerns the characteristics of the truth of cessation through the aspects of cessation, peace, excellence, and definitive emergence.

original: rnam pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: There are four aspects:🔽He discerns the characteristics of the truth of the path through the aspects of path, suitability, accomplishment, and definitive emergence.

original: lam gyi rnam pa dang / rigs pa'i rnam pa dang / sgrub pa'i rnam ba dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pas bden pa lam gyi mtshan nyid so sor rig par byed pa ste /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa dang / rigs pa'i rnam pa dang / sgrub pa'i rnam ba dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pas bden pa lam gyi mtshan nyid so sor rig par byed pa ste /
translated: The aspects of the path, the aspects of reasoning, the aspects of accomplishment, and the aspects of definite release.

original: de ni de'i mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: This is the attention of discernment of the characteristics of the truth of the path.

original: de la rnam pa bcus bden pa sdug bsngal la yongs su rtog par byed pa na /
analyzed: de la rnam pa bcus bden pa sdug bsngal la yongs su rtog par byed pa na /
translated: When one thoroughly investigates the truth of suffering through ten aspects,

original: rnam pa bzhi po dag gis rjes su 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po dag gis rjes su 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: one engages in it through four aspects.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'gyur ba'i rnam pa dang / 'jig pa'i rnam pa dang / bral ba'i rnam pa dang / chos nyid kyi rnam pa dang / nye ba'i rnam pa dang / kun du sbyor ba dang 'ching ba'i rnam pa dang / mi sdug pa'i rnam pa dang /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i rnam pa dang / 'jig pa'i rnam pa dang / bral ba'i rnam pa dang / chos nyid kyi rnam pa dang / nye ba'i rnam pa dang / kun du sbyor ba dang 'ching ba'i rnam pa dang / mi sdug pa'i rnam pa dang /
translated: The aspect of change, the aspect of destruction, the aspect of separation, the aspect of reality, the aspect of proximity, the aspect of fetters and bonds, the aspect of repulsiveness,

original: grub pa dang bde ba med pa'i rnam pa dang / dmigs su med pa'i rnam pa dang / rang dbang med pa'i rnam bas so //
analyzed: grub pa dang bde ba med pa'i rnam pa dang / dmigs su med pa'i rnam pa dang / rang dbang med pa'i rnam bas so //
translated: the aspect of the absence of establishment and happiness, the aspect of the absence of an object, and the aspect of the absence of independence.

original: rnam ba bcu po de dag kyang 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pas nye bar brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam ba bcu po de dag kyang 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pas nye bar brtag par bya ste /
translated: These ten aspects should be investigated by means of the reasoning of tenable proof.

original: de la re zhig yid ches pa'i lung ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig yid ches pa'i lung ni /
translated: First, the scriptures that inspire confidence are as follows.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “All conditioned things are impermanent.”

original: 'du byed de dag kyang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: 'du byed de dag kyang mdor bsdu na /
translated: Those conditioned things, in brief,

original: rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: are of two types:

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: the world of sentient beings and the world of the environment.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to that, the Bhagavān, from the perspective of the world of sentient beings, said,

original: dge slong dag ngas lha'i spyan rnam par dag pa mi'i las shin tu 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye pa dag nas lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten lha rnams kyi nang du skye pa'i bar dag kyang gzigs so zhes gsungs pa'i rnam grangs des ni /
analyzed: dge slong dag ngas lha'i spyan rnam par dag pa mi'i las shin tu 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye pa dag nas lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten lha rnams kyi nang du skye pa'i bar dag kyang gzigs so zhes gsungs pa'i rnam grangs des ni /
translated: “Bhikṣus, with my pure divine eye that surpasses the human, I see sentient beings passing away and being born, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, and I see that they are going to good or bad rebirths in accordance with their karma.

original: bcom ldan 'das spyan dang ldan pa mngon sum gyis gzigs pa mnga' bas re zhig sems can gyi 'jig rten la mi rtag ba nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das spyan dang ldan pa mngon sum gyis gzigs pa mnga' bas re zhig sems can gyi 'jig rten la mi rtag ba nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān, who has eyes and directly perceives, has taught impermanence in the world of sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis snod kyi 'jig rten gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis snod kyi 'jig rten gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The Bhagavān, considering the world of the environment,

original: 'di lta ste nyi ma bdun lta bu zhes bya ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'di lta ste nyi ma bdun lta bu zhes bya ba'i mdo las /
translated: in the sūtra called “Like Seven Suns,”

original: dge slong dag dus yun ring po 'das pa'i 'og tu 'jig rten du rim gyis nyi ma bdun 'char ba'i bar dag 'byung ba dang / sa chen po 'di dang / ri'i rgyal po ri rab dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig @178b rten gyi bar gyi snod kyi 'jig rten thams cad bsregs shing gzhob tu brlags nas /🔽du ba yang med /
analyzed: dge slong dag dus yun ring po 'das pa'i 'og tu 'jig rten du rim gyis nyi ma bdun 'char ba'i bar dag 'byung ba dang / sa chen po 'di dang / ri'i rgyal po ri rab dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig @178b rten gyi bar gyi snod kyi 'jig rten thams cad bsregs shing gzhob tu brlags nas / du ba yang med /
translated: said, “Monks, after a long time, seven suns appear in the world in sequence, and the entire world of the environment, this great earth, Mount Meru, king of mountains, and up to the Brahma world, is burned and reduced to ash.🔽There is no smoke.

original: thal ba'i lhag ma yang med par 'gyur pa'i dus kyang yod /
analyzed: thal ba'i lhag ma yang med par 'gyur pa'i dus kyang yod /
translated: There is not even an ash remainder.

original: skabs kyang yod par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i rnam grangs des ni /
analyzed: skabs kyang yod par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i rnam grangs des ni /
translated: This is the time and the occasion.”

original: bcom ldan 'das spyan dang ldan pa mngon sum du gzigs pa mnga' bas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das spyan dang ldan pa mngon sum du gzigs pa mnga' bas /
translated: The Lord, who has eyes and who sees directly,🔽has taught the impermanence of the world of the environment.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi mi rtag pa nyid bstan pa yin pas na rnal 'byor pa des re zhig yid ches pa'i lung de la brten nas dad ba'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi mi rtag pa nyid bstan pa yin pas na rnal 'byor pa des re zhig yid ches pa'i lung de la brten nas dad ba'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Therefore, the yogi/nī, relying on that trustworthy scripture,

original: 'du byed thams cad kyi mi rtag pa nyid la nges pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad kyi mi rtag pa nyid la nges pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: at first gains certainty in the impermanence of all compounded things by the power of faith.

original: des de ltar des pa thob nas dad pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: des de ltar des pa thob nas dad pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Having gained that certainty, by the power of faith,

original: mi rtag pa nyid la mngon sum nyid dang lkog tu ma gyur ba nyid dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa nyid yang dang yang du yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la mngon sum nyid dang lkog tu ma gyur ba nyid dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa nyid yang dang yang du yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: he/she repeatedly seeks out the directness, the non-obscurity, and the non-dependence on others regarding impermanence.

original: ji ltar yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su tshol bar byed ce na /
translated: How does he/she seek out?

original: smras pa dngos po gnyis rnam par 'jog par byed de /
analyzed: smras pa dngos po gnyis rnam par 'jog par byed de /
translated: It is said that he/she posits two things:

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: nang gi dngos po dang ; phyi rol gyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: nang gi dngos po dang ; phyi rol gyi dngos po'o //
translated: The internal thing and the external thing.

original: de la nang gi dngos po ni skye mched drug po gang yin pa dag go //
analyzed: de la nang gi dngos po ni skye mched drug po gang yin pa dag go //
translated: The internal things are the six sense-spheres.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po ni dngos po rnam pa bcu drug ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po ni dngos po rnam pa bcu drug ste /
translated: The external things are the sixteen kinds of things.

original: bcu drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the sixteen?

original: sa gzhi'i dngos po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sa gzhi'i dngos po 'di lta ste /
translated: The earth-things are as follows:🔽villages, towns, cities, houses, shops, etc.

original: grong dang / grong rdal dang / khang khyim dang / tshong khang la sogs pa dang / kun dga' ra ba'i dngos po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: grong dang / grong rdal dang / khang khyim dang / tshong khang la sogs pa dang / kun dga' ra ba'i dngos po 'di lta ste /
translated: The park-things are as follows:🔽trees, grass, medicinal herbs, forests, etc.

original: shing ljon pa dang / rtsva dang / sman dang / nags tshal la sogs pa dang / ri'i dngos po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shing ljon pa dang / rtsva dang / sman dang / nags tshal la sogs pa dang / ri'i dngos po 'di lta ste /
translated: The mountain-things are as follows:🔽the various kinds of mountains.

original: ri rnam pa sna tshogs su gnas pa rnams dang / chu'i dngos po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ri rnam pa sna tshogs su gnas pa rnams dang / chu'i dngos po 'di lta ste /
translated: The water-things are as follows:🔽springs, lakes, ponds, rivers, etc.

original: chu mig dang / mtsho dang / mtshe'u dang / chu klung la sogs pa dang ; las kyi mtha'i dngos po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chu mig dang / mtsho dang / mtshe'u dang / chu klung la sogs pa dang ; las kyi mtha'i dngos po 'di lta ste /
translated: The work-things are as follows:

original: zhing la sogs pa dang / sog 'jog gi dngos po mdzod la sogs pa dang / zas kyi dngos po dang / skom gyi dngos po dang / bzhon pa'i dngos po dang / gos kyi dngos po dang / rgyan gyi dngos po dang / bzhad gad dang /
analyzed: zhing la sogs pa dang / sog 'jog gi dngos po mdzod la sogs pa dang / zas kyi dngos po dang / skom gyi dngos po dang / bzhon pa'i dngos po dang / gos kyi dngos po dang / rgyan gyi dngos po dang / bzhad gad dang /
translated: vehicles,🔽clothing,🔽ornaments,🔽laughter,🔽song,🔽dance,🔽music,🔽incense,

original: glu bro dang / rol mo'i sgra'i dngos po dang / spos dang / me tog phreng dang / phyug pa'i dngos po dang / snod spyad kyi dngos po dang / snang ba dang / mun pa'i dngos po dang / pho mos dga' dgur spyod pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: glu bro dang / rol mo'i sgra'i dngos po dang / spos dang / me tog phreng dang / phyug pa'i dngos po dang / snod spyad kyi dngos po dang / snang ba dang / mun pa'i dngos po dang / pho mos dga' dgur spyod pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: flower garlands,🔽wealth,🔽utensils,🔽light,🔽darkness,🔽and the things of sexual intercourse.

original: de dag ni phyi rol gyi dngos po bcu drug yin no //🔽des de ltar nang dang phyi rol gyi @179a * //
analyzed: de dag ni phyi rol gyi dngos po bcu drug yin no // des de ltar nang dang phyi rol gyi @179a * //
translated: These are the sixteen external things.

original: dngos po rnam par bzhag nas /
analyzed: dngos po rnam par bzhag nas /
translated: Having thus established the internal and external things,🔽he, by means of the attention that is based on direct perception,

original: re zhig mngon sum gyi dbang du byas pa'i yid la byed pas nang gi dngos po'i 'gyur nyid yongs su tshol bar byed do /
analyzed: re zhig mngon sum gyi dbang du byas pa'i yid la byed pas nang gi dngos po'i 'gyur nyid yongs su tshol bar byed do /
translated: seeks the transformation of internal things.

original: de la nang gi dngos po'i 'gyur ba ni rnam ba bco lnga dang / 'gyur ba'i rgyu rnam pa brgyad yod do /
analyzed: de la nang gi dngos po'i 'gyur ba ni rnam ba bco lnga dang / 'gyur ba'i rgyu rnam pa brgyad yod do /
translated: There are fifteen types of internal changes and eight causes of change.

original: de la nang gi dngos po'i 'gyur ba rnam pa bco lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nang gi dngos po'i 'gyur ba rnam pa bco lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the fifteen types of internal changes?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gnas skabs las gyur pa dang / kha dog las gyur pa dang / dbyibs las gyur pa dang / 'byor pa dang rgyud pa las gyur pa dang / yan lag dang nying lag tshang ba dang ma tshang ba las gyur pa dang / yongs su ngal ba las gyur pa dang /
analyzed: gnas skabs las gyur pa dang / kha dog las gyur pa dang / dbyibs las gyur pa dang / 'byor pa dang rgyud pa las gyur pa dang / yan lag dang nying lag tshang ba dang ma tshang ba las gyur pa dang / yongs su ngal ba las gyur pa dang /
translated: change due to the condition, change due to color, change due to shape, change due to prosperity and decline, change due to the completeness or incompleteness of the major and minor body parts, change due to complete exhaustion,

original: gzhan gyi gnod pa byas pa las gyur pa dang / grang ba dang dro ba las gyur pa dang / spyod lam las gyur pa dang / reg pa las gyur pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa las gyur pa dang / na ba las gyur pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi gnod pa byas pa las gyur pa dang / grang ba dang dro ba las gyur pa dang / spyod lam las gyur pa dang / reg pa las gyur pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa las gyur pa dang / na ba las gyur pa dang /
translated: change due to the harm done by others, change due to cold and heat, change due to posture, change due to contact, change due to affliction, change due to illness,

original: 'chi ba las gyur pa dang / rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa las gyur pa dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi snang zhing yongs su zad pa las gyur pa'i 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba las gyur pa dang / rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa las gyur pa dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi snang zhing yongs su zad pa las gyur pa'i 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: des de ltar mngon sum gyi dbang du byas pa'i yid la byed pas 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid rnam par dpyad nas / 'du byed gzugs can gang dag gi skad cig la 'byung zhing /
translated: Having analyzed impermanence through change by means of attention directed to direct perception,🔽one sees that there are no conditioned things that arise in a moment and are destroyed and become nonexistent.

original: 'jig pa dang med par 'gyur ba yod cing med pa ma yin pa bzhin du mi mthong ba de la mngon sum gyi dbang du byas pa'i yid la byed pa la brten nas rjes su dpog par byed de /
analyzed: 'jig pa dang med par 'gyur ba yod cing med pa ma yin pa bzhin du mi mthong ba de la mngon sum gyi dbang du byas pa'i yid la byed pa la brten nas rjes su dpog par byed de /
translated: Not seeing that, one infers based on attention directed to direct perception.

original: 'di ltar rjes su dpog par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su dpog par byed do //
translated: One infers in the following way.

original: 'di ltar snga phyir gyur pa de lta bu dag ni 'du byed skad cig la 'byung zhing 'jig pa dang / med par 'gyur ba 'di dag la rigs kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar snga phyir gyur pa de lta bu dag ni 'du byed skad cig la 'byung zhing 'jig pa dang / med par 'gyur ba 'di dag la rigs kyi /
translated: Thus, it is reasonable that such changes occur in the momentary arising and destruction of conditioned phenomena and their nonexistence.

original: de kho na bzhin du gnas pa dag la ni mi rigs pas de phyir 'du byed rnams ni skad cig pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du gnas pa dag la ni mi rigs pas de phyir 'du byed rnams ni skad cig pa ste /
translated: It is unreasonable that they occur in things that remain just as they are. Therefore, conditioned phenomena are momentary.

original: rkyen de dang de dag yod na de lta de ltar 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: rkyen de dang de dag yod na de lta de ltar 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: When those and those conditions exist, they arise in such and such a way.

original: byung nas kyang 'jig pa'i rkyen la mi ltos par rang gi dang gis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byung nas kyang 'jig pa'i rkyen la mi ltos par rang gi dang gis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: And having arisen, they are destroyed by themselves without relying on a condition for destruction.

original: 'gyur pa'i rgyu rnam pa brgyad po gang dag yin pa de dag ni gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / rnam par 'gyur ba skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin gyi 'jig pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur pa'i rgyu rnam pa brgyad po gang dag yin pa de dag ni gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / rnam par 'gyur ba skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin gyi 'jig pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: The eight causes of change are the causes for the arising of transformation and change, but they are not the causes of destruction.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu de dang 'du byed zhigs pa rnams ni lhan cig pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu de dang 'du byed zhigs pa rnams ni lhan cig pa nyid yin pas /
translated: The cause of destruction and the disintegration of conditioned phenomena are simultaneous.

original: de'i phyir mi 'dra bar 'byung bar snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi 'dra bar 'byung bar snang ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it appears that they arise in a different way.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du mi 'byung ba nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du mi 'byung ba nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that they never occur at all.

original: 'du byed gang dag thams cad kyi thams cad du mi 'byung bar snang ba yang yod de /
analyzed: 'du byed gang dag thams cad kyi thams cad du mi 'byung bar snang ba yang yod de /
translated: There are also formations that never occur at all,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: such as a rabbit’s horns,🔽the horns of a cow, or the final end of a fire that has not been extinguished.🔽When water is boiled, it eventually completely evaporates.

original: dper na / chu bskol na mjug tu thams cad kyi thams cad du yongs su zad par 'gyur ba lta bu dang snod kyi 'jig rten bskal pa'i mes bsregs pa na mjug tu du ba yang @185a * //🔽med ; thal ba'i lhag ma yang med par 'gyur ba lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: dper na / chu bskol na mjug tu thams cad kyi thams cad du yongs su zad par 'gyur ba lta bu dang snod kyi 'jig rten bskal pa'i mes bsregs pa na mjug tu du ba yang @185a * // med ; thal ba'i lhag ma yang med par 'gyur ba lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: When the world is destroyed by the fire at the end of the eon, there is not even ash left.

original: de dag ni rgyu phyi ma phyi ma dag yongs su zad nas /
analyzed: de dag ni rgyu phyi ma phyi ma dag yongs su zad nas /
translated: These are destroyed when the subsequent causes are exhausted.

original: mjug tu thams cad kyi thams cad du med par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mjug tu thams cad kyi thams cad du med par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: They do not exist at all in the end.🔽But fire does not act in this way.

original: me ni de ltar mi byed pas de'i phyir brgyad po ji skad smos pa de dag ni 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: me ni de ltar mi byed pas de'i phyir brgyad po ji skad smos pa de dag ni 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the eight that are mentioned are the causes of change.

original: 'jig pa ni rang gi dang kho nas 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni rang gi dang kho nas 'jig pa yin no //
translated: But destruction is destroyed by itself.

original: des de ltar rjes su dpag pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pas /
analyzed: des de ltar rjes su dpag pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pas /
translated: Thus, through mental attention that arises from inference,

original: 'du byed skad cig la byung zhing 'jig pa dang / med par 'gyur ba de nyid la nges pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du byed skad cig la byung zhing 'jig pa dang / med par 'gyur ba de nyid la nges pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: he attains certainty with regard to the arising and passing away of conditioned entities in each moment and their non-existence.

original: nges pa thob nas kyang mngon sum ma yin pa'i 'jig rten pha rol du 'du byed 'jug par rjes su dpog par byed de /
analyzed: nges pa thob nas kyang mngon sum ma yin pa'i 'jig rten pha rol du 'du byed 'jug par rjes su dpog par byed de /
translated: Having attained certainty, he infers the continuation of conditioned entities in the other world, which is not directly perceived.

original: 'di ltar rjes su dpog par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su dpog par byed do //
translated: He infers in the following manner:

original: sems can gang dag kha dog bzang ba dang / kha dog ngan pa dang / rigs mtho ba dang / rigs dma' ba dang / phyug po'i khyim du skyes pa dang / dbul po'i khyim du skyes pa dang / dbang chung bar grags pa dang /
analyzed: sems can gang dag kha dog bzang ba dang / kha dog ngan pa dang / rigs mtho ba dang / rigs dma' ba dang / phyug po'i khyim du skyes pa dang / dbul po'i khyim du skyes pa dang / dbang chung bar grags pa dang /
translated: Those sentient beings who are beautiful or ugly, of high or low caste, born into a wealthy or poor family, of little or great influence,

original: dbang che bar grags pa dang / tshe ring ba dang / tshe thung ba dang / tshig gzung bar 'os pa dang / tshig gzung bar 'os pa ma yin pa dang / dbang po rno ba dang / dbang po rtul ba dag kyang yod de /🔽sems can sna tshogs de dag la ni /🔽las sna tshogs kyang yod par rigs la ;🔽med par mi rigs pas /
analyzed: dbang che bar grags pa dang / tshe ring ba dang / tshe thung ba dang / tshig gzung bar 'os pa dang / tshig gzung bar 'os pa ma yin pa dang / dbang po rno ba dang / dbang po rtul ba dag kyang yod de / sems can sna tshogs de dag la ni / las sna tshogs kyang yod par rigs la ; med par mi rigs pas /

original: sems can de lta bu dag gis ni /🔽sngon dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las de lta bu sna tshogs dag gdon mi za bar byas shing bsags pa yin te /🔽rgyu de dang rkyen des na de dag gi lus de lta bu sna tshogs dag mngon par grub pa yin no //🔽de ni dbang phyug gis sprul pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin par yang mi rigs te /🔽gal te dbang phyug gis sprul pa'i rgyu las byung ba zhig yin par gyur na /
analyzed: sems can de lta bu dag gis ni /🔽sngon dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las de lta bu sna tshogs dag gdon mi za bar byas shing bsags pa yin te /🔽rgyu de dang rkyen des na de dag gi lus de lta bu sna tshogs dag mngon par grub pa yin no //🔽de ni dbang phyug gis sprul pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin par yang mi rigs te /🔽gal te dbang phyug gis sprul pa'i rgyu las byung ba zhig yin par gyur na /

original: de dbang phyug gi rkyen kho na las byung ba zhig gam /
analyzed: de dbang phyug gi rkyen kho na las byung ba zhig gam /
translated: Are they produced only through the condition of Īśvara?

original: 'on te dbang phyug gis sprul pa'i rkyen gzhan zhig las byung ba yin grang na /
analyzed: 'on te dbang phyug gis sprul pa'i rkyen gzhan zhig las byung ba yin grang na /
translated: Or are they produced through another condition that is emanated by Īśvara?

original: gal te dbang phyug gi rkyen kho na las byung ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug gi rkyen kho na las byung ba yin na ni /
translated: If they are produced only through the condition of Īśvara,

original: de na dbang phyug dang 'du byed de dag go mnyam du 'byung bar 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de na dbang phyug dang 'du byed de dag go mnyam du 'byung bar 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
translated: then it is not tenable that Īśvara and those compositional factors arise simultaneously.

original: ji ste dbang phyug snga la 'du byed rnams phyis 'byung na ni /
analyzed: ji ste dbang phyug snga la 'du byed rnams phyis 'byung na ni /
translated: But if Īśvara existed first and the compositional factors arose later,

original: des na dbang phyug du byed rnams kyi rkyen ma yin pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na dbang phyug du byed rnams kyi rkyen ma yin pas mi rung ngo //
translated: then it is not tenable that Īśvara is the condition of the compositional factors.

original: ji ste dbang phyug gi 'dod pa dang / rtsol ba dang / smon lam dang / @185b sprul pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin na ni des na dbang phyug kho na las byung ba ma yin pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ji ste dbang phyug gi 'dod pa dang / rtsol ba dang / smon lam dang / @185b sprul pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin na ni des na dbang phyug kho na las byung ba ma yin pas mi rung ngo //
translated: If they arose from the cause of Īśvara’s desire, exertion, aspiration, and emanation, then it is not tenable that they arose from Īśvara alone.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag kyang rgyu dang bcas pa yin nam 'on te rgyu med pa zhig yin /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag kyang rgyu dang bcas pa yin nam 'on te rgyu med pa zhig yin /
translated: Are those desires and so on caused or are they uncaused?

original: gal te rgyu dang bcas pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang bcas pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: If it has a cause,

original: rgyu dbang phyug kho na yin pas des na skyon snga ma dang 'dra bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu dbang phyug kho na yin pas des na skyon snga ma dang 'dra bas mi rung ngo //
translated: then since its cause is God alone, the error is the same as before and that is unacceptable.

original: ji ste rgyu gzhan zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: ji ste rgyu gzhan zhig yin na ni /
translated: If it has another cause,

original: des na ji ltar 'dod pa dang / rtsol ba dang / smon lam dang / sprul pa dag gi rgyu dbang phyug ma yin pa chos gzhan zhig yod pa de bzhin du 'du byed thams cad kyang chos gzhan gyi rgyu las byung ba yin pa kho nar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: des na ji ltar 'dod pa dang / rtsol ba dang / smon lam dang / sprul pa dag gi rgyu dbang phyug ma yin pa chos gzhan zhig yod pa de bzhin du 'du byed thams cad kyang chos gzhan gyi rgyu las byung ba yin pa kho nar 'gyur bas /
translated: then just as the cause of desire, effort, aspiration, and emanation is not God but is another phenomenon, in the same way, all compounded phenomena arise from the cause of another phenomenon.

original: dbang phyug yin par brtags pa don med pa des ci zhig bya /
analyzed: dbang phyug yin par brtags pa don med pa des ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the point of imagining that God is the cause?

original: de ltar rjes su dpag pa las byung pa'i yid la byed pa de dag la sogs pa de lta bu dang mthun pa dag gis 'jig rten pha rol du 'du byed rnams la 'jug par 'gyur ba la nges par 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpag pa las byung pa'i yid la byed pa de dag la sogs pa de lta bu dang mthun pa dag gis 'jig rten pha rol du 'du byed rnams la 'jug par 'gyur ba la nges par 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, through such mental attention that arises from inference, one definitely obtains the ascertainment that compounded phenomena engage in a subsequent world.

original: de de ltar yid la byed pa rnam pa gsum po dad pa'i dbang du byas pa dang / mngon sum gyi dbang du byas pa dang / rjes su dpag pa'i dbang du byas pa'i dbang gis mi rtag pa nyid la rnam par dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: de de ltar yid la byed pa rnam pa gsum po dad pa'i dbang du byas pa dang / mngon sum gyi dbang du byas pa dang / rjes su dpag pa'i dbang du byas pa'i dbang gis mi rtag pa nyid la rnam par dpyod par byed do //
translated: Thus, he examines impermanence by means of the three types of mental attention: attention that is faith-based, attention that is based on direct perception, and attention that is based on inference.

original: de la sngar bsgoms pa rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i mi rtag pa rnam pa lnga bstan pa gang yin pa de la 'gyur ba'i rnam pa dang / 'jig pa'i rnam pa ni bstan zin na /
analyzed: de la sngar bsgoms pa rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i mi rtag pa rnam pa lnga bstan pa gang yin pa de la 'gyur ba'i rnam pa dang / 'jig pa'i rnam pa ni bstan zin na /
translated: Among the five aspects of impermanence that were previously cultivated and taught, the aspects of change and destruction have already been explained.

original: bral ba'i rnam pa'i mi rtag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bral ba'i rnam pa'i mi rtag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is impermanence in the sense of separation?

original: de yang nang dang phyi rol la brten pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang nang dang phyi rol la brten pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as being based on the internal and the external.

original: de la nang la brten pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nang la brten pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is based on the internal?

original: 'di lta ste la la zhig sngon gzhan dag gi rje bor gyur cing bran ma yin pa dang / mngag gzhug ma yin pa dang / rang dbang can dang / las mi ma yin par gyur pa las /

translated: For example, someone who was previously a master of others, not a slave, not a servant, independent, and not subject to the control of another,

original: de dus gzhan gyi tshe na /
analyzed: de dus gzhan gyi tshe na /
translated: At that time,🔽you will be separated from the status of a master and from the status of being free, and you will become a slave to others.

analyzed: rje bo'i dngos po dang / bran ma yin pa'i dngos po dang bral zhing gzhan dag gi bran nyid du gyur nas /

analyzed: gter ngan par sbas pa las chud zos pa'am /

analyzed: nyid gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: You will be separated from wealth and possessions that have not been lost, wasted, or destroyed.🔽You will be separated from wealth and possessions that have not been lost, wasted, or destroyed.🔽You

original: 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa nyid dang bral ba'i mi rtag pa nyid gang yin pa de dag nyid da ltar byung ba'i dus su nye bar ma gyur du zin kyang 'du byed 'di dag ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su de lta bu'i chos nyid dang /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa nyid dang bral ba'i mi rtag pa nyid gang yin pa de dag nyid da ltar byung ba'i dus su nye bar ma gyur du zin kyang 'du byed 'di dag ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su de lta bu'i chos nyid dang /
translated: The impermanence of change, the impermanence of destruction, and the impermanence of separation are not present in the present moment. However, these formations will have that nature in the future.

original: de lta bu dang mthun par 'gyur ba yin no zhes ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ba'i chos nyid yin par so sor rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun par 'gyur ba yin no zhes ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ba'i chos nyid yin par so sor rtog par byed do //
translated: In this way, one should discern the nature of destruction that will occur in the future.

original: de la nye ba'i rnam pa'i mi rtag pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nye ba'i rnam pa'i mi rtag pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is impermanence in the sense of proximity?

original: 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa nyid dang / bral ba'i mi rtag pa nyid gang yin pa de dag nyid mngon sum du gyur pa la kun du rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa nyid dang / bral ba'i mi rtag pa nyid gang yin pa de dag nyid mngon sum du gyur pa la kun du rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: The impermanence of change, the impermanence of destruction, and the impermanence of separation are directly perceived.

original: des de ltar nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnams kyi mi rtag pa nyid rnam pa lnga po dag la /
analyzed: des de ltar nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnams kyi mi rtag pa nyid rnam pa lnga po dag la /
translated: In this way, one should discern the five aspects of impermanence of internal and external formations.

original: rnam pa lnga po de dag gis ci rigs par yid la byas shing lan mang du byas pa dang ; 'thad pa bsgrub pa'i rigs pa'i dbang du byas pas nges pa thob nas de'i 'og tu sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa la 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po de dag gis ci rigs par yid la byas shing lan mang du byas pa dang ; 'thad pa bsgrub pa'i rigs pa'i dbang du byas pas nges pa thob nas de'i 'og tu sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa la 'jug par byed de /
translated: Having gained certainty through the five aspects, as appropriate, through frequently bringing them to mind and through the power of reasoning that establishes tenability, then subsequently one engages the aspect of suffering.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: One should think as follows:

original: 'du byed mi rtag pa gang yin pa de dag gi mi rtag pa nyid ni skye ba'i chos nyid yin par rigs te /
analyzed: 'du byed mi rtag pa gang yin pa de dag gi mi rtag pa nyid ni skye ba'i chos nyid yin par rigs te /
translated: The impermanence of those formations that are impermanent is reasonable as the reality of birth.

original: de ltar na 'du byed 'di dag ni skye ba'i chos can yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'du byed 'di dag ni skye ba'i chos can yin la /
translated: Thus, these formations are characterized by birth.

original: skye ba ni sdug bsngal ba yin pa dang / skye ba ji lta ba bzhin du rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / sdug pa dang bral ba dang / 'dod pas phongs pa dag kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o snyam du sems te /
analyzed: skye ba ni sdug bsngal ba yin pa dang / skye ba ji lta ba bzhin du rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / sdug pa dang bral ba dang / 'dod pas phongs pa dag kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o snyam du sems te /
translated: Just as with birth, one should understand aging, sickness, death, encountering the unpleasant, separation from the pleasant and the suffering of the lower realms in the same way.

original: de ltar re zhig mi rtag pa'i rnam pas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig mi rtag pa'i rnam pas /
translated: Thus, one engages the aspect of suffering through the aspect of impermanence.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa la 'jug par byed do //
translated: He penetrates the aspect of suffering.

original: de kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba'i rnam pas ni bde ba'i tshor ba dang / mthun pa'i phung po zag pa dang bcas pa dang / nye bar len pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de dag la sdug bsngal gyi rnam par 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: de kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba'i rnam pas ni bde ba'i tshor ba dang / mthun pa'i phung po zag pa dang bcas pa dang / nye bar len pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de dag la sdug bsngal gyi rnam par 'jug par byed de /
translated: He penetrates the aspect of suffering in the aggregates that are associated with pleasant feeling, that are contaminated, and that are appropriated, by way of the fetters and the bonds.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni sred pa'i kun du sbyor ba'i gnas yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni sred pa'i kun du sbyor ba'i gnas yin la /
translated: Because they are the basis of the fetter of craving.

original: sred pa'i kun du sbyor ba yang skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang ; 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa'i 'ching ba dang /
analyzed: sred pa'i kun du sbyor ba yang skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang ; 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa'i 'ching ba dang /
translated: The fetter of craving is the basis of the bonds of birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, dejection, and mental distress.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi 'ching ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi 'ching ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis of the bonds of desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: mi sdug pa'i rnam pas ni sdug bsngal ba dang mthun @186b pa'i phung po rnams la sdug bsngal gyi rnam par 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i rnam pas ni sdug bsngal ba dang mthun @186b pa'i phung po rnams la sdug bsngal gyi rnam par 'jug par byed do //
translated: The aspect of repulsiveness causes one to engage the aggregates that are conducive to suffering as suffering.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal dang mthun pa'i chos rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / nye bar len pa dang bcas pa dang / yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa dang / gnas ngan len dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid las rnam par ma grol ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal dang mthun pa'i chos rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / nye bar len pa dang bcas pa dang / yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa dang / gnas ngan len dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid las rnam par ma grol ba dang /
translated: Thus, the aggregates that are conducive to suffering are those that are contaminated, those that are appropriated, those that are associated with mental dissatisfaction, those that are associated with indisposition, those that are not liberated from the nature of suffering,

original: mi rtag pa dang / 'gog pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de la grub pa dang / bde ba med pa'i rnam pas ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / 'gog pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro // de la grub pa dang / bde ba med pa'i rnam pas ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: those that are impermanent, and those that are subject to cessation.🔽The aspect of being devoid of substantiality and devoid of pleasure causes one to engage the aggregates that are conducive to neither suffering nor pleasure as suffering.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / mthun pa'i phung po rnams la sdug bsngal gyi rnam par 'jog par byed de 'di ltar sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / mthun pa'i phung po rnams la sdug bsngal gyi rnam par 'jog par byed de 'di ltar sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: Thus, the aggregates that are conducive to neither suffering nor pleasure are those that are not conducive to the three types of suffering.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / mthun pa'i phung po rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / nye bar len pa dang bcas pa dang / gnas ngan len dang ldan pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sa bon dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / mthun pa'i phung po rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / nye bar len pa dang bcas pa dang / gnas ngan len dang ldan pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sa bon dang ldan pa dang /
translated: The aggregates that are conducive to pleasure are contaminated, they possess appropriation, they possess negative tendencies, they possess the seeds of pleasure and pain,

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal las rnam par ma grol ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / 'gog pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal las rnam par ma grol ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / 'gog pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they possess suffering, they are not liberated from the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of pervasive conditioning, they are impermanent, and they are subject to cessation.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor pa de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor pa de 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, the yogi/nī should understand that the formations that are conducive to pleasure,🔽in the aspect of fetters and bonds, are the suffering of change in relation to the feeling of pleasure, and that the aggregates that are conducive to neither pleasure nor suffering,

original: kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba'i rnam pas bde ba dang mthun pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / bde ba'i tshor ba las 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid du zhugs pa dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba'i rnam pas bde ba dang mthun pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / bde ba'i tshor ba las 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid du zhugs pa dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: in the aspect of fetters and bonds, are the suffering of pervasive conditioning in relation to the feeling of neither pleasure nor suffering.

original: mi sdug pa'i rnam pas sdug bsngal dang mthun pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la sdug bsngal nyid du zhugs pa dang ; 'di lta ste /🔽grub ba dang bde ba med pa'i rnam pas sdug bsngal yang ma yin /🔽bde ba yang ma yin pa dang mthun pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i rnam pas sdug bsngal dang mthun pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la sdug bsngal nyid du zhugs pa dang ; 'di lta ste / grub ba dang bde ba med pa'i rnam pas sdug bsngal yang ma yin / bde ba yang ma yin pa dang mthun pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la /
translated: He engages the formations that are conducive to suffering through the aspect of their being unpleasant and the feeling of suffering through the aspect of suffering.🔽He engages the formations that are conducive to neither pleasure nor suffering through the aspect of their being neither established nor blissful.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid du zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid du zhugs pa yin no //
translated: He engages the feeling that is neither pleasurable nor suffering through the aspect of the suffering of the formations.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /🔽kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba'i rnam pa dang / mi sdug pa'i rnam pa dang / grub ba dang bde ba med pa'i rnam pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te / kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba'i rnam pa dang / mi sdug pa'i rnam pa dang / grub ba dang bde ba med pa'i rnam pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: He thinks to himself:

original: tshor ba gsum po gang cung zad ci chor yang rung ste /
analyzed: tshor ba gsum po gang cung zad ci chor yang rung ste /
translated: “The three types of feelings that are conditioned by the various types of bonds, ties, unpleasantness, and the absence of establishment and bliss

original: de dag ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba yin no snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba yin no snyam du sems te /
translated: are, in this case, suffering.”

original: de ltar na de mi rtag pa'i rnam pa sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas /
analyzed: de ltar na de mi rtag pa'i rnam pa sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas /
translated: Thus, by means of attention preceded by the aspect of impermanence,

original: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: he enters into the aspect of suffering.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /🔽bdag @187a * //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te / bdag @187a * //
translated: He thinks as follows:

original: gis dbang bo tsam dang / yud tsam dang / de las byung ba'i tshor ba tsam dang / sems tsam zhig mthong bar zad kyi /
analyzed: gis dbang bo tsam dang / yud tsam dang / de las byung ba'i tshor ba tsam dang / sems tsam zhig mthong bar zad kyi /
translated: “I see only the mere sense faculties, the mere moments, the mere sensations arising from them, and the mere mind.

original: bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba ni ming tsam dang / snang ba tsam dang / nye bar btags ba tsam du zad de /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba ni ming tsam dang / snang ba tsam dang / nye bar btags ba tsam du zad de /
translated: ‘Self’ and ‘mine’ are mere names, mere appearances, mere designations.

original: de las gong na yang med la /
analyzed: de las gong na yang med la /
translated: There is nothing higher than that.

original: de las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: de las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing greater than that.

original: de ltar yod pa de yang phung po tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de ltar yod pa de yang phung po tsam du zad de /
translated: That which exists in this way is exhausted in the mere aggregates.

original: phung po de dag la ni gang skye bar 'gyur ba'am /🔽rga bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: phung po de dag la ni gang skye bar 'gyur ba'am / rga bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: In those aggregates, there is no self that arises,🔽that ages,🔽that becomes ill,

original: na bar 'gyur ba'am /🔽'chi bar 'gyur ba'i bdag gam /
analyzed: na bar 'gyur ba'am /🔽'chi bar 'gyur ba'i bdag gam /
translated: or that dies.

original: sems can rtag pa dang brtan pa dang / ther zug dang / bdag por gyur pa de dang / de dag tu las byas shing /
analyzed: sems can rtag pa dang brtan pa dang / ther zug dang / bdag por gyur pa de dang / de dag tu las byas shing /
translated: “There is no permanent, stable, or enduring sentient being or self that is the owner of these actions, nor is there anyone who experiences the results of actions that have been performed and ceased.

original: byas pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu so sor myong bar 'gyur ba ni 'ga' yang med pas de'i phyir 'du byed 'di dag ni stong pa dang / bdag med pa yin no snyam du sems te /
analyzed: byas pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu so sor myong bar 'gyur ba ni 'ga' yang med pas de'i phyir 'du byed 'di dag ni stong pa dang / bdag med pa yin no snyam du sems te /
translated: Therefore, these formations are empty and devoid of self.”

original: de ltar dmigs su med pa'i rnam pas stong pa'i rnam pa la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs su med pa'i rnam pas stong pa'i rnam pa la 'jug par byed do //
translated: In this way, he engages with the aspect of emptiness by way of the nonapprehension of objects.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks as follows:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i 'du byed gang dag yin pa de dag kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir rang dbang med pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i 'du byed gang dag yin pa de dag kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir rang dbang med pa yin no //
translated: “Those formations that are endowed with specific and general characteristics and the characteristic of suffering are not independent because they originate in dependence on conditions.

original: rang dbang med pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni bdag med pa yin no snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rang dbang med pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni bdag med pa yin no snyam du sems te /
translated: Those that are not independent are devoid of self.”

original: de ltar rang dbang med pa'i rnam pas bdag med pa'i rnam pa la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar rang dbang med pa'i rnam pas bdag med pa'i rnam pa la 'jug par byed do //
translated: Thus, one enters into the aspects of selflessness through the aspects of non-independence.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor pa des rnam pa bcus yang dag par bsdus pa'i rnam pa bzhi po dag gis bden pa sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid so sor rig par gyur pa yin no ;
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor pa des rnam pa bcus yang dag par bsdus pa'i rnam pa bzhi po dag gis bden pa sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid so sor rig par gyur pa yin no ;
translated: In this way, the yogin has understood the characteristics of the truth of suffering through the four aspects that are included in the ten aspects.

original: / de la mi rtag pa'i rnam pa ni rnam pa lngas yang dag par bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: / de la mi rtag pa'i rnam pa ni rnam pa lngas yang dag par bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The aspect of impermanence is included in five aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'gyur ba'i rnam pa dang / 'jig pa'i rnam pa dang / bral ba'i rnam pa dang / chos nyid kyi rnam pa dang / nye ba'i rnam pa dag gis so //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i rnam pa dang / 'jig pa'i rnam pa dang / bral ba'i rnam pa dang / chos nyid kyi rnam pa dang / nye ba'i rnam pa dag gis so //
translated: the aspect of change, the aspect of destruction, the aspect of separation, the aspect of reality, and the aspect of proximity.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ni rnam pa gsum gyis yang dag par bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ni rnam pa gsum gyis yang dag par bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The aspect of suffering is included in three aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: kun du sbyor ba dang 'ching ba'i rnam pa dang / mi sdug pa'i rnam pa dang / grub pa dang / bde ba med pa dag gi rnam pas so //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba dang 'ching ba'i rnam pa dang / mi sdug pa'i rnam pa dang / grub pa dang / bde ba med pa dag gi rnam pas so //
translated: the aspect of fetters and bonds, the aspect of unpleasantness, and the aspect of non-establishment and non-happiness.

original: stong pa'i rnam pa ni rnam pa gcig gis yang dag par bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: stong pa'i rnam pa ni rnam pa gcig gis yang dag par bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The aspect of emptiness is included in one aspect,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: dmigs su med pa'i rnam @187b pas so //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i rnam @187b pas so //
translated: the aspect of non-apprehension.

original: bdag med pa'i rnam pa yang rnam pa gcig gis yang dag par bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i rnam pa yang rnam pa gcig gis yang dag par bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The aspect of selflessness is included in one aspect,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: rang dbang med pa'i rnam pas so //🔽de de ltar rnam pa bzhi'i rjes su zhugs pa'i rnam pa bcu po dag gis sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid so sor rig nas gang zhig spangs na sdug bsngal 'di spong bar 'gyur bar /
analyzed: rang dbang med pa'i rnam pas so // de de ltar rnam pa bzhi'i rjes su zhugs pa'i rnam pa bcu po dag gis sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid so sor rig nas gang zhig spangs na sdug bsngal 'di spong bar 'gyur bar /
translated: the aspect of non-independence.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gang yin zhes rnam pa bzhis bden pa kun 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid so sor rig par byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gang yin zhes rnam pa bzhis bden pa kun 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid so sor rig par byed do //
