original: de ni bsgom pa'i las rnam pa brgyad yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bsgom pa'i las rnam pa brgyad yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the eightfold activity of meditation.

original: de la bsgom pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni rnam pa bcu gcig yod par rig par bya ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la bsgom pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni rnam pa bcu gcig yod par rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The classification of meditation should be understood as elevenfold:

original: zhi gnas bsgom pa dang / lhag mthong ba sgom pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i lam bsgom pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam bsgom pa dang / lam chung ngu bsgom pa dang / lam 'bring po bsgom pa dang / lam chen po bsgom pa dang /
analyzed: zhi gnas bsgom pa dang / lhag mthong ba sgom pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i lam bsgom pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam bsgom pa dang / lam chung ngu bsgom pa dang / lam 'bring po bsgom pa dang / lam chen po bsgom pa dang /
translated: the meditation of serenity, the meditation of transcendent insight, the meditation of the mundane path, the meditation of the supramundane path, the meditation of the small path, the meditation of the middling path, the meditation of the great path,

original: sbyor ba'i lam bsgom pa dang / bar chad med pa'i lam bsgom pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam bsgom pa dang / khyad par gyi lam bsgom pa'o //🔽de la zhi gnas bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam bsgom pa dang / bar chad med pa'i lam bsgom pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam bsgom pa dang / khyad par gyi lam bsgom pa'o // de la zhi gnas bsgom pa ni /
translated: the meditation of the path of application, the meditation of the immediate path, the meditation of the path of liberation, and the meditation of the distinctive path.

original: sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meditation of serenity is the nine mental states, as previously described.

original: lhag mthong bsgom pa yang snga ma kho na bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag mthong bsgom pa yang snga ma kho na bzhin no //
translated: The meditation of transcendent insight is also as previously described.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam bsgom pa ni sa 'og ma pa rnams la rags par lta ba dang / sa gong ma pa rnams la zhi bar lta ba nyid kyis ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar gyi 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam bsgom pa ni sa 'og ma pa rnams la rags par lta ba dang / sa gong ma pa rnams la zhi bar lta ba nyid kyis ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar gyi 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the mundane path is the freedom from attachment to the levels below, up to the sphere of nothingness, by means of the view of the coarseness of the lower levels and the view of the calmness of the higher levels.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam bsgom pa ni sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas yid la byed pa dang / lam gyi bar la lam gyi sgo nas yid la byed pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa zag pa med pa'i lam gyis yod min med min skye mched kyi bar gyi 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam bsgom pa ni sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas yid la byed pa dang / lam gyi bar la lam gyi sgo nas yid la byed pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa zag pa med pa'i lam gyis yod min med min skye mched kyi bar gyi 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the supramundane path is the freedom from attachment to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception by means of the uncontaminated path, such as right view, which takes suffering as its object by means of the aspect of suffering, up to taking the path as its object by means of the aspect of the path.

original: de la lam chung ngu bsgom pa ni gang gis nyon mongs pa rags pa dang chen po spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la lam chung ngu bsgom pa ni gang gis nyon mongs pa rags pa dang chen po spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the small path is that by means of which one abandons the coarse and great afflictions.

original: de la lam 'bring po bsgom pa ni gang gis nyon mongs pa 'bring po spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la lam 'bring po bsgom pa ni gang gis nyon mongs pa 'bring po spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the medium path is that by which one abandons the medium defilements.

original: de la lam chen po bsgom pa ni gang gis thams cad kyi tha mar spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu spong bar byed pa'o //🔽de la sbyor ba'i lam bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: de la lam chen po bsgom pa ni gang gis thams cad kyi tha mar spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu spong bar byed pa'o // de la sbyor ba'i lam bsgom pa ni /
translated: The cultivation of the great path is that by which one abandons the weak defilements, which are the last to be abandoned.

original: gang gis nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir sbyor ba rtsom par byed pa'o //🔽de la @193a * //🔽par chad med pa'i lam bsgom pa ni gang gis nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir sbyor ba rtsom par byed pa'o // de la @193a * // par chad med pa'i lam bsgom pa ni gang gis nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the path of application is that by which one begins the application for the sake of abandoning the defilements.🔽The cultivation of the uninterrupted path is that by which one abandons the defilements.

original: de la rnam par grol ba'i lam bsgom pa ni gang gis nyon mongs pa spangs ma thag tu rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par grol ba'i lam bsgom pa ni gang gis nyon mongs pa spangs ma thag tu rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the path of liberation is that by which one realizes liberation immediately after abandoning the defilements.

original: de la khyad par gyi lam bsgom pa ni gang gis de'i gong du sa gzhan gyi sbyor ba brtsam par bya ba'i bar la rtsom par mi byed pa dang / mthar thug pa la rtsom par mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la khyad par gyi lam bsgom pa ni gang gis de'i gong du sa gzhan gyi sbyor ba brtsam par bya ba'i bar la rtsom par mi byed pa dang / mthar thug pa la rtsom par mi byed pa ste /
translated: The cultivation of the special path is that by which one does not begin to prepare for another stage above it, nor does one begin to prepare for the ultimate.

original: de ni bsgom pa'i rnam par dbye ba rnam pa bcu gcig yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bsgom pa'i rnam par dbye ba rnam pa bcu gcig yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that there are eleven types of cultivation.

original: de ltar bsgom pa la brtson pa'i dus dus su nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa rnams la yongs su dpyod par byed pa dang / dus dus su kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la sems kun du skyo bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa la brtson pa'i dus dus su nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa rnams la yongs su dpyod par byed pa dang / dus dus su kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la sems kun du skyo bar byed pa dang /
translated: At times, one who is thus striving in cultivation thoroughly examines the afflictions that have been abandoned and those that have not been abandoned. At times, one thoroughly disheartens the mind with regard to things that cause one to become disheartened.

original: dus dus su mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la sems mngon par dga' bar byed pa de ni de'i dga' ba sdud pa'i yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dus dus su mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la sems mngon par dga' bar byed pa de ni de'i dga' ba sdud pa'i yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: At times, one delights the mind with regard to things that cause one to become delighted. This is the mental attention that gathers delight.

original: des dga' ba bsdus pa'i yid la byed pa de kun du bsten cing goms par byas la lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des dga' ba bsdus pa'i yid la byed pa de kun du bsten cing goms par byas la lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Through the cause of repeatedly cultivating and familiarizing with the attention that includes joy, in order to abandon all afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation,🔽

original: thams cad kyi tha mar slob pa'i rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi tha mar slob pa'i rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Through cultivating, becoming habituated to, and increasing that mental attention that includes joy, the vajra-like meditative stabilization arises at the end of all the meditative stabilizations.

original: de skyes pas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar byed do //
analyzed: de skyes pas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar byed do //
translated: Through its arising, all afflictive emotions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation are abandoned.

original: ci'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the vajra-like meditative stabilization?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na rdo rje ni de las gzhan pa'i nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'u rya dang / rin po che shang ka shi la dang / byi ru la sogs pa nor bu thams cad kyi nang na mchog dang gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: dper na rdo rje ni de las gzhan pa'i nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'u rya dang / rin po che shang ka shi la dang / byi ru la sogs pa nor bu thams cad kyi nang na mchog dang gtso bo yin te /
translated: For example, a vajra is the best and most preeminent of all jewels, pearls, lapis lazuli, śaṅkha shells, crystal, coral, and so forth.

original: thams cad pas sra ba dang / thams cad pas brtan pa yin la /
analyzed: thams cad pas sra ba dang / thams cad pas brtan pa yin la /
translated: It is harder than all and more solid than all.

original: de las gzhan pa thams cad 'bigs par byed cing /🔽de las gzhan pa'i nor bu dag gis mi phigs pa de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de yang /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa thams cad 'bigs par byed cing / de las gzhan pa'i nor bu dag gis mi phigs pa de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de yang /
translated: It pierces all other things,🔽and other gems cannot pierce it.

original: slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi nang na mchog dang gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi nang na mchog dang gtso bo yin te /
translated: Likewise, this concentration is the best and foremost of all concentrations of learners.

original: thams cad pas sra ba dang / thams cad pas brtan pa yin la nyon mongs pa thams cad zil gyis gnon bar byed cing /
analyzed: thams cad pas sra ba dang / thams cad pas brtan pa yin la nyon mongs pa thams cad zil gyis gnon bar byed cing /
translated: It is harder than all and steadier than all, and it overwhelms all afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan dag gis zil gyis gnon par mi nus @193b pas na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan dag gis zil gyis gnon par mi nus @193b pas na /
translated: Other afflictions cannot overwhelm it.

original: de'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the vajra-like concentration.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin de skyes ma thag tu nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gyur pa gnas ngan len gyi sa bon thams cad yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir sems shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / rigs yongs su dag pa thob pa dang /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin de skyes ma thag tu nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gyur pa gnas ngan len gyi sa bon thams cad yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir sems shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / rigs yongs su dag pa thob pa dang /
translated: Immediately after the vajra-like concentration arises, the seeds of the negative tendencies that are on the side of the afflictions are completely destroyed, and so the mind is completely liberated and one attains the completely pure lineage.

original: nyon mongs pa zad pa rnams la zad pa shes pa skye ba dang / rgyu zad pa'i phyir phyis thams cad kyi thams cad du sdug bsngal skye bar mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zad pa rnams la zad pa shes pa skye ba dang / rgyu zad pa'i phyir phyis thams cad kyi thams cad du sdug bsngal skye bar mi 'gyur bas /
translated: The knowledge of elimination arises for those who have eliminated the afflictions and because the cause is eliminated, suffering will not arise again in the future.🔽

original: mi skye bar shes pa yang skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi skye bar shes pa yang skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The knowledge of elimination arises for those who have eliminated the afflictions and the knowledge of nonarising arises because suffering will not arise again in the future due to the exhaustion of its cause.

original: de de'i tshe na dgra bcom pa /
analyzed: de de'i tshe na dgra bcom pa /
translated: At that time, one becomes an arhat,

original: zag pa zad pa /🔽bya ba byas pa /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa / bya ba byas pa /
translated: one who has exhausted the contaminants,

original: byed pa byas pa /
analyzed: byed pa byas pa /
translated: one who has done what had to be done,

original: khur bor ba /
analyzed: khur bor ba /
translated: one who has cast off the burden,

original: bdag gi don rjes su thob pa /
analyzed: bdag gi don rjes su thob pa /
translated: one who has accomplished one's own goal,

original: srid pa kun du sbyor ba yongs su zad pa /
analyzed: srid pa kun du sbyor ba yongs su zad pa /
translated: one who has utterly exhausted the fetters of existence,

original: yang dag pa'i shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba mi slob pa'i chos bcu po /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba mi slob pa'i chos bcu po /
translated: one who has attained complete mastery over one's mind through perfect knowledge, one who has attained the ten qualities of the arhat and

original: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: the ten qualities of no more learning, namely, the right view of no more learning, the right thought of no more learning, the right speech of no more learning, the right action of no more learning, the right livelihood of no more learning, the right effort of no more learning, the right mindfulness of no more learning, the right concentration of no more learning, the right wisdom of no more learning and the right liberation of no more learning.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: right liberation, and right knowledge.

original: gnas pa dang / yid la byed pa dag la rang gi sems kyis dbang sgyur bar byed cing /
analyzed: gnas pa dang / yid la byed pa dag la rang gi sems kyis dbang sgyur bar byed cing /
translated: He has mastery over his own mind in terms of abiding and mental activity.

original: de 'phags pa'am lha 'am /
analyzed: de 'phags pa'am lha 'am /
translated: He abides in whatever exalted, divine, or

original: tshangs pa'i gnas pa gang dang gang dag gis gnas par 'dod pa de dang de dag gis gnas par byed pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dge ba don dang ldan pa gang dang gang dag yid la byed par 'dod pa de dang de dag yid la byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas pa gang dang gang dag gis gnas par 'dod pa de dang de dag gis gnas par byed pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dge ba don dang ldan pa gang dang gang dag yid la byed par 'dod pa de dang de dag yid la byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Brahmic abodes he wishes to abide in. He attends to whatever virtuous, meaningful mundane and supramundane phenomena he wishes to attend to.

original: de la 'phags pa'i gnas pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / smon pa med pa la gnas pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i gnas pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / smon pa med pa la gnas pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: Here, the so-called exalted abodes are the abodes of emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: lha'i gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa'o //🔽tshangs pa'i gnas pa zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang / @194a * //
analyzed: lha'i gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa'o // tshangs pa'i gnas pa zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang / @194a * //
translated: Divine abiding is abiding in the meditative concentrations and formless absorptions.🔽Brahmic abiding is abiding in loving kindness,

original: snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la gnas pa'o //
translated: compassion, joy, and equanimity.🔽Ultimate is the ultimate, the limit of reality.🔽Stainless is the stainless, the Dharma body.🔽Pure is the pure, the enjoyment body.🔽Fully perfected is the fully perfected, the emanation body.🔽Unrestricted is unrestricted, the uncontaminated.🔽Having crossed the moat is having crossed the moat, having crossed over the afflictions.🔽Having destroyed the thicket is having destroyed the thicket, having destroyed the afflictions.

original: shin tu mthar thug pa dang / shin tu dri ma med pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa shin tu mthar phyin pa dang / gtan pa med pa dang / 'obs dral ba dang / 'obs las rgal ba dang / shing thags bcom pa dang /
analyzed: shin tu mthar thug pa dang / shin tu dri ma med pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa shin tu mthar phyin pa dang / gtan pa med pa dang / 'obs dral ba dang / 'obs las rgal ba dang / shing thags bcom pa dang /
translated: Noble is noble, the noble path.🔽Having lowered the banner is having lowered the banner, having lowered the afflictions.🔽Having abandoned the five is having abandoned the five, having abandoned the five branches of the higher realms.🔽Endowed with the six is endowed with the six, endowed with the six perfections.🔽Abiding in the base is abiding in the base, abiding in the base of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'phags pa dang / rgyal mtshan bsnyal ba dang / yan lag lnga spangs pa dang / yan lag drug dang ldan pa dang / rten gzhi la gnas pa dang / so so'i bden pa bstsal ba dang / tshol ba spangs pa dang ; yang dag pa'i rtog pa dri ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa dang / rgyal mtshan bsnyal ba dang / yan lag lnga spangs pa dang / yan lag drug dang ldan pa dang / rten gzhi la gnas pa dang / so so'i bden pa bstsal ba dang / tshol ba spangs pa dang ; yang dag pa'i rtog pa dri ma med pa dang /
translated: Having abandoned the individual truths is having abandoned the individual truths, having abandoned the truths of suffering and so on.🔽Having abandoned searching is having abandoned searching, having abandoned the search for the four noble truths.🔽Stainless right thought is stainless right thought, uncontaminated right thought.

original: lus kyi 'du byed shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / ma 'dres pa dang / bsnyen pa dang ldan pa dang / gang zag bla na med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / ma 'dres pa dang / bsnyen pa dang ldan pa dang / gang zag bla na med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The fully purified composition of the body, the fully liberated mind, the fully liberated wisdom, the unmixed, the endowed with the near, and the unsurpassed person.🔽

original: bde bar gnas pa rnam pa drug po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bde bar gnas pa rnam pa drug po 'di lta ste /
translated: The six kinds of mental ease are as follows:

original: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong na yid bde bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong na yid bde bar mi 'gyur /
translated: When the eye sees forms, it does not become happy,

original: yid mi bde bar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yid mi bde bar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: nor does it become unhappy.🔽It remains in equanimity, mindfulness, and awareness.

original: btang snyoms dang dran ba dang / shes bzhin du gnas pa dang / de bzhin du rna bas sgra rnams dang ; snas dri rnams dang / lces ro rnams dang / lus kyis reg bya rnams dang / yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes na yid bde bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: btang snyoms dang dran ba dang / shes bzhin du gnas pa dang / de bzhin du rna bas sgra rnams dang ; snas dri rnams dang / lces ro rnams dang / lus kyis reg bya rnams dang / yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes na yid bde bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Similarly, when the ear hears sounds, the nose smells smells, the tongue tastes tastes, the body feels touchables, and the mind cognizes phenomena, it does not become happy,🔽nor does it become unhappy.

original: yid mi bde bar mi 'gyur bar btang snyoms dang dran pa dang / shes bzhin du gnas pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: yid mi bde bar mi 'gyur bar btang snyoms dang dran pa dang / shes bzhin du gnas pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: It remains in equanimity, mindfulness, and awareness.

original: des de'i tshe na 'dod chags ma lus par zad pa yang dag par myong zhing /
analyzed: des de'i tshe na 'dod chags ma lus par zad pa yang dag par myong zhing /
translated: At that time, they experience the complete exhaustion of desire,

original: zhe sdang ma lus par zad pa dang / gti mug ma lus par zad pa yang dag par myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhe sdang ma lus par zad pa dang / gti mug ma lus par zad pa yang dag par myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: the complete exhaustion of anger, and the complete exhaustion of delusion.

original: de'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ma lus par zad pa'i phyir sdig pa gang yin pa de dag mi byed cing /
analyzed: de'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ma lus par zad pa'i phyir sdig pa gang yin pa de dag mi byed cing /
translated: Because their desire, anger, and delusion are completely exhausted, they do not engage in any nonvirtuous actions,

original: dge ba rnams la rten par byed pa dang / nam mkha' dang lag mthil du mnyam pa dang / tsan dan dang ste'u mtshungs pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / dbang po dang / nye dbang @194b dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis phyag bya bar 'os shing mchod par 'os pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba rnams la rten par byed pa dang / nam mkha' dang lag mthil du mnyam pa dang / tsan dan dang ste'u mtshungs pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / dbang po dang / nye dbang @194b dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis phyag bya bar 'os shing mchod par 'os pa dang /
translated: but rely on virtuous actions, and their minds are equal to the sky and the palm of the hand, like sandalwood and a piece of wood, and they are worthy of being worshipped and venerated by the gods, including Indra and Upendra.

original: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la gnas pa yin te /
translated: They abide in the realm of nirvāṇa without remainder.

original: rgal ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / lus tha mar 'dzin pa zhes kyang bya'o ;
analyzed: rgal ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / lus tha mar 'dzin pa zhes kyang bya'o ;
translated: They are called “those who have crossed over,” “those who have reached the other shore,” and “those who hold their last body.”

original: / sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pas 'phangs ba'i phung po rnams rang gi dang gis 'gags pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i nye bar len pa med pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir phung po lhag ma med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: / sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pas 'phangs ba'i phung po rnams rang gi dang gis 'gags pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i nye bar len pa med pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir phung po lhag ma med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang 'gyur te /
translated: The aggregates that were projected by previous karma and afflictions cease by themselves, and because there is no other appropriation of aggregates and no rebirth, they pass into nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates.

original: de la ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yang 'ga' yang med la 'khor bar 'khor ba yang 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: de la ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yang 'ga' yang med la 'khor bar 'khor ba yang 'ga' yang med de /
translated: In that case, there is no nirvāṇa at all, and there is no saṃsāra at all.

original: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de 'gags pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / de bsil bar gyur pa dang / de nub par gyur ba kho nar zad do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de 'gags pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / de bsil bar gyur pa dang / de nub par gyur ba kho nar zad do //
translated: There is only the cessation of suffering, its pacification, its cooling down, and its disappearance.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: phung po kun spangs pa /
analyzed: phung po kun spangs pa /
translated: The abandonment of the aggregates,

original: sred pa zad pa /
analyzed: sred pa zad pa /
translated: the exhaustion of craving,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: the freedom from attachment,

original: 'gog pa / mya ngan las 'das pa'i go 'phang de ni zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa / mya ngan las 'das pa'i go 'phang de ni zhi ba yin no //
translated: the cessation, and the attainment of nirvāṇa are peace.

original: de'i rtags ni 'di lta bu dag yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rtags ni 'di lta bu dag yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The signs of this should be understood as follows.

original: dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa ni gnas lnga la brten par mi srid pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa ni gnas lnga la brten par mi srid pa yin te /
translated: It is impossible for a bhikṣu arhat whose contaminants have been exhausted to rely on five things:

original: bsams bzhin du srog chags rnams kyi srog gcod pa dang / ma byin pa len pa dang / mi changs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos la brten pa dang / shes bzhin du brdzun gyi tshig smra bar mi srid pa dang / 'dod pa rnams stsogs shing longs spyod par mi srid pa'o //🔽de bzhin du bde ba dang / sdug bsngal rang gis byas par khas len par mi srad pas na ;
analyzed: bsams bzhin du srog chags rnams kyi srog gcod pa dang / ma byin pa len pa dang / mi changs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos la brten pa dang / shes bzhin du brdzun gyi tshig smra bar mi srid pa dang / 'dod pa rnams stsogs shing longs spyod par mi srid pa'o // de bzhin du bde ba dang / sdug bsngal rang gis byas par khas len par mi srad pas na ;
translated: it is impossible for him to intentionally kill living beings, to take what is not given, to engage in sexual union, to lie knowingly, or to enjoy and consume sense objects such as forms.🔽Similarly, it is impossible for him to accept that pleasure and pain are self-produced.

original: snga ma bzhin du rang gis kyang ma byas /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rang gis kyang ma byas /
translated: As before, it is impossible for him to produce pleasure and pain by himself.

original: gzhan gyis kyang ma byas la rgyu med pa las byung ba'i bar du yang khas len par mi srid pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po rnams kyis 'jig pa skye bar mi srid pa dang / 'brug sgra @195a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang ma byas la rgyu med pa las byung ba'i bar du yang khas len par mi srid pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po rnams kyis 'jig pa skye bar mi srid pa dang / 'brug sgra @195a * //
translated: It is impossible to accept that it is produced by itself, by another, by both, or without a cause. It is impossible for things that are indeterminate to produce destruction.🔽Even if one sees any terrifying or frightening things, such as a loud clap of thunder, a violent lightning strike, or a terrifying and frightening person, one is not frightened.

original: drag po dang / gnam lcags drag po 'bab pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'jigs su rung ba gang yang rung ba dag mthong yang skrag par ma 'gyur ba dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: drag po dang / gnam lcags drag po 'bab pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'jigs su rung ba gang yang rung ba dag mthong yang skrag par ma 'gyur ba dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that these are similar to that.

original: de la rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: Among them, the vajra-like concentration is the mental attention at the end of practice.

original: 'bras bu'i mchog dgra bcom pa nyid kyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i mchog dgra bcom pa nyid kyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yid la byed pa yin te /
translated: The mental attention that is included in the supreme fruit of arhatship is the mental attention that is the fruit of the end of practice.

original: de ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i yid la byed pa bdun po de dag gis ni shin tu mthar thug pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i yid la byed pa bdun po de dag gis ni shin tu mthar thug pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by these seven attentions included in the supramundane path, one attains the ultimate end.

original: de ni nyon thos kyis zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni nyon thos kyis zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the śrāvaka vehicle.

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: For example,

original: ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ga'i tshogs dang / rang bzo dang ; gsang tshig gi bstan bcos thams cad kyi ma mo yi ge'i phyi mo yin pa dang 'dra bar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa mtha' dag gi ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ga'i tshogs dang / rang bzo dang ; gsang tshig gi bstan bcos thams cad kyi ma mo yi ge'i phyi mo yin pa dang 'dra bar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi nyan thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa mtha' dag gi ma lta bu yin no //
translated: just as the alphabet is the mother of all treatises on grammar and secret spells, and of all collections of names, words, and letters, in the same way, the śrāvaka vehicle is like a mother for all the disciples of all the perfect buddhas.

original: sdom ni / mtshan nyid so sor rig pa dang // de bzhin mos pa las byung dang // rab tu dben dang dga' sdud dang // de bzhin dpyod pa'i yid byed dang // gzhan yang sbyor ba mthar thug dang // de yi 'bras bu tha ma yin //
analyzed: sdom ni / mtshan nyid so sor rig pa dang // de bzhin mos pa las byung dang // rab tu dben dang dga' sdud dang // de bzhin dpyod pa'i yid byed dang // gzhan yang sbyor ba mthar thug dang // de yi 'bras bu tha ma yin //
translated: and the one of the final fruit.🔽The divisions of the concentrations and formless states,🔽the meditative equipoise, the superknowledges,🔽the births, the signs,🔽the analysis of the truths, the realizations,

original: bsam gtan gzugs med rnams dbye dang // snyoms par 'jug dang mngon shes dang // skye ba dang ni rtags rnams dang // bden pa dpyad dang rtogs pa dang // de bzhin bsgom pa'i rnam dbye dang // mthar thug gyur pa tha ma yin //
analyzed: bsam gtan gzugs med rnams dbye dang // snyoms par 'jug dang mngon shes dang // skye ba dang ni rtags rnams dang // bden pa dpyad dang rtogs pa dang // de bzhin bsgom pa'i rnam dbye dang // mthar thug gyur pa tha ma yin //
translated: and likewise the divisions of the meditations,🔽and the final culmination is the last.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa nyan thos kyi sar gtogs pa las /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa nyan thos kyi sar gtogs pa las /
translated: In the Levels of Yogic Deeds that are included in the levels of the hearers,

original: rnal 'byor gyi gnas bzhi pa rdzogs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi gnas bzhi pa rdzogs te /
translated: the fourth yoga is complete.

original: nyan thos kyi sa rdzogs te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa rdzogs te /
translated: The levels of the hearers are complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ban de ye shes sde la sogs pas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ban de ye shes sde la sogs pas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
translated: The Indian abbot Jinamitra and the great editor-in-chief, the monk Yeshé Dé, and others translated and edited this text.

original: // /'di la shlo ka drug stong yod do /
analyzed: // /'di la shlo ka drug stong yod do /
translated: It has six thousand ślokas.
